Reviews.Title: “Very Good!”
Reviews.Author: Bill463
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights - Monday March 11 & Tuesday March 12, 2012. Came to Chicago to attend the Home & Housewares Show at McCormick with my partner for work and also enjoyed this trip as a little getaway for the two of us. I thought it was a very good hotel. Had a king room on the 17th floor facing Michigan Ave. in the corner - was really nice. After walking the show all day it was nice to return here and then walk around the city a bit - great restaurants in the area. Everyone at the hotel was very friendly, and the room was great. I loved it and hope to return in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value on N. Michigan Avenue”
Reviews.Author: moprep
Reviews.Content: Stayed March 2-4, 2012. I had gotten a fantastic rate of $85/night through Travelzoo, and was not expecting much. I must say I was pleasantly surprised. While the rooms are on the small size, this is a pretty well kept property. Friendly, accommodating staff made it even more pleasant. The location, around the corner from North Michigan Avenue, puts you squarely in the middle of tons of upscale shopping and restaurants. Cross over Michigan Ave, head west a few blocks, and you're in the hip River North area, also with great restaurants and boutiques. The big selling point about this hotel is the value, and location.

Reviews.Title: “1st Visit to Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Matthew M
Reviews.Content: I needed a midweek getaway, and found this hotel through Expedia, it had enough support from Tripadvisor and from the map the area looked good. When I arrived I wasn't disappointed. The rooms are clean, modern, and for the most part quiet. Some rooms near the elevators or ice machine, maybe noisy as in all hotels; and higher floors might drown out street noise (honks/sirens), but I had no problem sleeping. Front desk staff was courteous and not overly friendly, as many a Chicagoan are, just enough to give you the basics. Housekeeping was good, everything was cleaned each afternoon I came back. Location is within a block off the Magnificent Mile/N Michigan Ave at the corner of XXI, Gap, and Guess. It is very near original Pizzeria Unos, original Billy Goat, 10-15min walk to Navy Pier, 10-15min walk to Millennium Park/Art Institute, 20-30min walk to Sears/Willis Tower, 5min walk to Hancock Observatory/Water Tower. I didn't drive, so from O hare by the blue line it will take about an hour plus 10-15min walk to hotel. To get to the subway from the hotel, there is the red line which is the central line from the south side/Sox to the north side/Cubs about 5-10min walk away. The #146 and 147 buses stop on Michigan Ave to/from the I will say the beds are nice, but soft as a cloud. I can see for some that could be a hit or a miss. loop/museums/sears etc. Overall I would recommend and would stay again. By the way there is a nice bar in the hotel, but no restaurant

Reviews.Title: “Chicago Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Mdt948
Reviews.Content: Took my 9-year old for a museum tour of Chicago and wanted to find something in the city that was still affordable. The Inn Of Chicago was well priced for a downtown hotel, and parking was better than most. The room had 2 comfortable beds, and was a standard size similar to a Holiday Inn or Best Western. No issues with hearing the neighbors, or anything for that matter. Was on the east side of the builing which doesn't provide the best veiws, but again for the price and location was well worth it. If looking for romance or veiws, check out Park Hyatt or Sofitel, if you want location and price go Inn Of Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place for price”
Reviews.Author: mele22
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right off the mag mile and although a bit dated and small fro the price and location it was worth it. There are plenty of restaurants shops and attraction within walking distance to accommodate your touristy needs,.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at the Inn of Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Ashley A
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Chicago to visit some friends for a girl's weekend and we chose to stay at the Inn of Chicago since the rates were pretty cheap (for Magnificent Mile area) and it looked like it was a hotel in decent condition. Our stay was a pleasant one. I don't think any of us had any major issues with the hotel or the room. The rooms were quaint, but clean. Our room had two queen beds that were adorned with fresh white linens, and the room also had a nice armoire for storing any clothing as needed. The bathroom seemed to be newly updated, it had a new vanity which was nice, and it was clean. We also received a free drink ticket at the bar in the lobby upon check-in which was a nice bonus as well since drinks downtown can get pretty spendy. The only downfall of our room was, the windows had little grates in them so it kind of made it seem like a cell of some sort, but it wasn't a huge deal since we weren't planning on sitting in the room staring out the windows, anyways. All in all, I give this hotel an average rating. It was nice, near lots of shopping, and close to Ginos!

Reviews.Title: “Great!!”
Reviews.Author: Jdoug22
Reviews.Content: Came to Chicago because my niece was auditioning and wanted a hotel near Magnificent Mile. I read other reviews and booked it online, 2 double beds for $89 a night. Yes the bathroom is small, but clean and updated. The rom was clean and nice looking. The beds were ok, not top of the line but better than some 4 stars I have stayed at. Elevators are small but clean and not slow at all. Lobby is beautiful and staff was great. Dunkin Donuts is right across the street, and 7-11 just past that. You are close to many major attractions. I will stay here again, it was great!

Reviews.Title: “March '12 stay”
Reviews.Author: syncopatin_1
Reviews.Content: Stayed for Amtrak overnight convenience layover. Boutique hotel at Magnificent Mile. Room was basic, quiet and comfortable. This is a 100% no-smoking hotel. When we arrived early evening, we had just gotten off long distance train and our checked bag was full of brown/gray dust. Asked at the desk for a damp rag to wipe it off, a housekeeper was dispatched to bring us extra washcloths. The first room we were assigned (19th floor) reeked of fresh cigarette smoke (we suspected from an occupied room next door). As I called down to request a different room, the housekeeper arrived with the washcloths and verified that indeed the room smelled. Housekeeper and desk both profusely apologized and we were promptly given another room. Only real concern is that the bathroom could have been cleaner.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the Price!”
Reviews.Author: YourNextGuest
Reviews.Content: This is a nice property that is VERY well located. It is historic, so don't expect a new hotel feeling, but it is well kept. the rooftop is very nice too!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: natys_mommy
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel once before and when we were planning this recent trip to Chicago we knew that we wanted to stay there again. The hotel is in a great location. Just one block from Michigan Ave., walking distance to many of the local attractions (Hancock building, Millenium park). The price is unbeatable for the location. I would reccommend that you try to book a corner room though. My parents were staying in an inside room while we had a corner room. The inside room was much smaller. Kinda cramped with a king size bed.

Reviews.Title: “You won't be disappointed”
Reviews.Author: ajaMichigan
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a four day stay and have only good things to say about the hotel. Location couldn't be better. Great rate on Choice hotels website. 1/2 block from Michigan Ave. and right on all the bus lines. We came into Millenium station and the bus(157) dropped us right in front of the hotel. Easy walk to tons of restaurants, shopping and Navy Pier. Transportation is so easy in Chicago. Leave your car outside the city (so you don't have to pay to park) and buy a CTA pass (at CVS) that will take you anywhere. Bus drivers are very helpful. We requested a larger room and had no problem with the request. Bathrooms are small, would of liked a vanity instead of pedestal sink. Beds average. The West Egg Cafe is excellent for breakfast and right around the corner. 7/11 and Dunkin Donuts right across the street. We have stayed in a lot of hotels in downtown Chicago and will definitely be back. Best place we have stayed for the price and location!

Reviews.Title: “Very conveniently located, nice place”
Reviews.Author: tinib85
Reviews.Content: I had to run an errand in Chicago and needed a place to stay near N. Michigan Avenue and Huron St. The Inn of Chicago is only a block of Michigan Ave (the Magnificent Mile), and thus super conveniently located. Everything from shopping, sightseeing, museums, etc. is very easily reached from this hotel either on foot or - for those not so much into the concrete-stomping - by bus or train. Subway stations are close. Even the lakeshore and the Ohio St beach are just a few blocks from the Inn. The room I was staying in was the typical standard; nothing fancy, but clean enough and quiet, though a bit dark. There is a fitness room that all guests can use and access with their room key any time of the day. The Inn doesn't have its own restaurant, but a bar, and a coffeeshop right next door where breakfast, coffee and snacks are sold. The only minor complaint I had: they only provide shampoo, conditioning and bar soap in those little tubes. I had hoped for a real body wash and a lotion. But then I paid only $79 for the room (in mid-February).

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: sunnytsui
Reviews.Content: the location is great, just off the north michigan ave. But the room is old.

Reviews.Title: “1 Year Ago vs Today”
Reviews.Author: Apie0402
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed the night here last week (as well as the same time last year). We were just looking for a place to stay after a day of taking in the city. Ultimately we didnâ€™t plan on being in the room for an extended period of time so it was really just a place to sleep. Last time we were here, the floor we stayed on was under construction. With that said, improvements have been made to the rooms since our last stay. They did what they could with the space provided. New beds and furnishings made gave it a more contemporary feel. My husband felt the carpeting needed to be updated, but I thought it was fine. It was striped so I think he felt that it was old, but I think they were trying to stay with the color scheme. Last stay we had 2 double beds. The room and bathroom were more spacious overall. This time we stayed in the king room, which was significantly smaller (I felt). This hotel attempts to stay modern and contemporary. During this stay we found out that there is a rooftop patio which would be fun in the summer months. Also, the lobby bar was hopping as we headed out for dinner. The walls are very thin. We were out pretty late, but you could hear complete conversation of people walking in the hallway at 2am and which TV program they were watching next door. Would we stay here again, YES for a place to spend the night, but if you are looking for luxury this is not the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, tiny rooms, inflated price.”
Reviews.Author: G W
Reviews.Content: There are nicer, cheaper rooms available at different hotels in the neighboring area. For the rates that they charged per night, I would have expected much nicer rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location... Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jjcain
Reviews.Content: You can't ask for a better location if you're staying in downtown Chicago. It's centrally located close to great restaurants and shops along the "Magnificent Mile". I found the majority of the hotel staff to not be very friendly. The rooms were adequate size, but you could hear the folks staying next door due to the ventilation system... you could actually see the lights in the room next door when looking through the vent while standing in the bathroom. I would say this is an average hotel. You can find way nicer accomodations, but I'm sure you could equally find way worse as well.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money on the Magnificent Mile”
Reviews.Author: dipayanb
Reviews.Content: I got a very good deal for this hotel as part of a flight+hotel bid on priceline. I was a bit skeptical about it, but it surely didn't disappoint. It is located a few steps away from the magnificent mile. The Art Institute, the Millennium Park and the Navy Pier are all within walking distance. The 22-floor hotel also provides a good view of the city from the terrace. The rooms are small, but clean and well appointed and there are room delivery options from nearby restaurants. Might encounter a long wait if you are checking in the afternoon and the hotel seemed to a bit difficult to deal with if you are a smoker.

Reviews.Title: “Very well located”
Reviews.Author: Bchea
Reviews.Content: The Inn of Chicago Hotel is very well located, 10 minutes of walk from the beach, 5 minutes from the shopping mall, everything seems accessible from the hotel. The hall is very warm, staff are nice. The rooms aren't fancy, but they are comfortable enough to stay a couple of days. No breakfast included... but a lot of restaurants near the place.

Reviews.Title: “Near everything, clean rooms, great value”
Reviews.Author: Lyndsey R
Reviews.Content: The Inn offers what I need in a hotel. A Very very clean room Very quiet in the evening and early morning. Could not hear any other guests. Bed was comfortable and the room didn't have any of those crazy hotel room sounds (buzzing, water dripping, etc). The rooms are very basic and that is fine because I am not in Chicago to stay in a hotel room. The only thing that may bother some other travelers is the bathroom is slight and there isn't an onsite restaurant. However the coffee shop adjacent is lovely. In my past I traveled for business and would have felt this hotel was perfect for my needs. If I am planning future trips I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel !”
Reviews.Author: Paulo Vitor B
Reviews.Content: I spend three days with my family in this hotel and we had a good time there, because people were good and had patience with us. So, I recommend this hotel because it is in the downtown of Chicago and it is very close of everything that you want to do in Chicago ! The structure of the hotel also is very good, including good dorms, gym and cable TV.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location but Awful Room”
Reviews.Author: Linette87
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 2 nights over New Years Eve and Day. The location of the hotel is perfect. It is close to Navy Pier and everything else. The hotel is nice itself and the rooms were clean. The AC unit was loud and didnt work properly. You have to read the instructions if you can find them. The AC was blowing in January. The next night I finally figured it out. The beds were awful. You get like cardboard blankets. They are very hard and loud. If you are looking for an average hotel close to Navy Pier I would recommend this hotel but just for a night or 2.

Reviews.Title: “Best location for a good price”
Reviews.Author: Homero A
Reviews.Content: Near Michigan ave. one of the main streets of Chicago, great rooms, free wifi in the lobby, great attention.

Reviews.Title: “Worst sleep of my life in a hotel...”
Reviews.Author: RebaS83
Reviews.Content: Tiny and cramped room...felt like I was in a dorm room. Part of the carpet had.about a 3 inch hole in it. No vanity in bathroom and sink was awkward. Also the cable cord was kind of hanging off the wall..it was weird. Lobby gives you false hope as its very modern and welcoming. However it is a great location and cheap for the location. My one big issue was that the peep hole on door is on the side rather the middle so makes me a little nervous about opening the door. It made me question my safety a little bit. The bed was comfortable, except the pillows... one pillow was too flat but 2 were too much so it was an uncomfortable sleep for my neck. Also, temperature in the room would not stay constant...which also caused for trouble sleeping. However for the purpose I booked the room, it did its job for a less than 16 hour stay...but longer stays I would not recommend this.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Stay”
Reviews.Author: cora
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel,Great Location with great service my husband and I love this hotel this is our fourth stay.Every stay is wonderful The staff was very friendly and helpful the room are clean and spacious the lobby area has a feel of home very comfortable and clean.If you are traveling through chicago and looking for a place to stay then consider the Inn of Chicago

Reviews.Title: “If you like to wait!”
Reviews.Author: locohog
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel do to campany contract. This hotel doesn't respect contracts it has signed. This past Sunday we spent almost 2 hours in the lobby awaiting rooms, and this is for someone that is to already have a room do to signed contract. Think if it was you showing up with a simple reservation. You could get stuck waiting even more than that. This does happen regularly. We never get treated like this at the other Comfort Inn chain hotels we stay at. Rooms are questionably clean.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Location”
Reviews.Author: alilodd80
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Inn of Chicago on two different trips. We were happy with our experience both times. The location is perfect for shopping and going to tourist sites. It's a great place to crash when visiting a great city!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in the city of Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Brent g
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Inn of Chicago was good and they have ideal location for easy getting around in the city of Chicago going to place most people go while on vacation. Pro: 1. Nice beds with clean sheets 2. LCD TV 32' 3. Renvoated room 4. Good location Cons; 1. Bathroom is small 2. Hot water controller on shower was too hot or too cold. Likely need some adjustment. 3. They do charge for internet but I brought my wireless toggle and sprint worked great in there building no complaints. All in all it good stay with choice hotels

Reviews.Title: “They Would NOT Work With Me!”
Reviews.Author: JMSTORM82
Reviews.Content: This looks like a great hotel and it probably is. My issue is not with the hotel but instead with the staff. My wife and I booked a room with this hotel in October 2011. We had a friend coming in to town and thought we would spend a day in Chicago as we try to do several times a year. We are from Peoria, IL but enjoy spending a couple weeks a year in the Windy City. On this particular trip, we decided to give this hotel a shot. Look at the pictures, how can you not want to stay here at least once?! We were really excited about the trip but early in day, we experienced some setbacks. Our friends flight was delayed by over three hours. Coming from Peoria, the flight delay would have put us quite a bit behind on all we wanted to do. We contacted the hotel at about 9am and asked to either cancel the room or reserve it for the following day instead. We explained the situation and we were simply told "sorry, there is nothing we can do for you". They hung up and that was the end of it. I called and left several messages for the manager but he/she never returned my call. Now we are planning another trip to Chicago to get away for 3 or 4 days but I think we will go back to the Comfort Suites on N. Michigan Ave. They have always worked well with us when we need something. Their staff is great and they trust that if something comes up, we will be back! I donâ€™t want to this is a bad hotel because I see a lot of people love it; hopefully we just had a bad experience...or lack thereof.

Reviews.Title: “Good value at the best location at Magnificent Mile”
Reviews.Author: Felipe C
Reviews.Content: Hotel isn't new, but room was very comfortable and clean. Located at the heart of Magnificent Mile. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “If your shopping on the Mag Mile”
Reviews.Author: jimsellshomes
Reviews.Content: We had a one night stay in a southeast corner room during the busy shopping week before Christmas. This hotel works out great if you are planning a trip that revolves around the shopping on Michigan Ave. It's a bit further from the CTA EL lines than we like but there are plenty of mass transit options along Michigan Ave 1 block away. The room we stayed had a living area and a bedroom that could be closed off for privacy. The bathroom was a bit cramped so if you are planning a longer stay or have more than 2 in this room it would be best to check with the hotel directly about other room types. Our room on the 6th floor did get a bit of road and pedestrian noise but not uncomfortable for us. Request a higher floor if possible. The lobby was inviting and there was direct access to LaVazza coffee. Great if the weather is bad. On the 22nd floor there is a rooftop deck with some pretty good views of the city. Walk directly east from the hotel and you can access the Lakefront path via a tunnel under Lake Shore Drive. The hotel parking garage is located 1 block down and across the street but for a better value we opted to park at the surface lot on the south side of Illinois Ave at St Clair at $28 for a 24 hour period. It's an easy 2 block walk directly south of the hotel along St Clair. You'll save $8 by walking 1 block farther on the same street. We enjoyed the stay with the exception of the really noisy sheets. When one of us even moved just a little it was quite noticable.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location and facilities for the price!”
Reviews.Author: SeikoPath
Reviews.Content: We are a couple of students who were looking for a place to stay within our budget. We ended up paying less than a hostel for a private room with 2 double beds and super clean facilities. The front desk was super helpful and the location was absolutely unbeatable - you're steps away to some really high end shops on North Michigan Ave! Highly recommended! Only possible con was that there was no free wireless internet in the room, but there is in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location - Heart of the Action”
Reviews.Author: liz4rls_cardsfan
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is not anything fancy or extravagant. The rooms are servicable, although the bathrooms are small (as are the bathrooms in a lot of older hotels in Chicago.) The rooms are neat and tidy, but the pillows I found to be a little hard and lumpy. But the real reason to stay here is more than just the room. It's one block off Michigan on Ohio, with a bus stop at the top of the block on Michigan. Easy access to all public transportation - - minutes from the loop. There is also a small cafe adjecent to the hotel, good for a quick, simple bite, sweet treat or cup of coffee. Mary's Cafe is also just one block over if you want a real breakfast. YUM! There is also a 7-11 across the street, as well as a 24-hour Dunkin' Donuts/Baskin Robins. SCORE! ;) I got a super-cheap rate of $80 through their website, the Monday/Tuesday of Christmas Week, so our annual holiday trip was super-affordable. I've stayed here many times and found the staff to be always helpful. I also notice that a lot of airline and Amtrak staff stay at this hotel, which must mean it's a preferred hotel for many travel-savvy workers.

Reviews.Title: “The Magnificent Mile- what more can I say”
Reviews.Author: TessaClare
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for my cousin's wedding in June 2010- the whole guest list stayed in the hotel, which was awesome!. The location is unbeatable! In a side street right off the Magnificent mile, which is what Chicago is all about. So close to shops, restaurants, Millenium Park, you can walk to the beach and you can even walk to the Pier! that is quite far but I did it in midsummer, was beautiful! The only thing that was far was the metro, but I think there was a closer one that was under consrtuction. it was great to be in the bustle of the city, but by being in a side street made it a little quieter just outside the hotel, which was good, because those streets can be packed with people so you lose each other quickly. It is purely a hotel - a room ( very spacious, with 2 double beds, cupboard space, a TV etc) and quite a small bathroom for American standards, but well equiped with shampoo, towels etc. and a shelf to put your toiletry bag on- useful! there was a coffee maker in the room, but I am a tea drinker - no luck there. No complaints about the rooms, clean and comfortable. We were super high up so our view wasnt too bad, but it was just other buildings, as its in the city centre. there is a gym and a balcony - very pretty but it was mighty windy up there when I went up. Aircon very effective - a must in hot summer! There isnt a restaurant or any food provided, but lots of restaurants and cafes around, and the DUnkin DOnut across the street was a popular breakfast venue. Taxi fare from central station wasnt bad- we came in on the train. Would stay there again for the location. Just be prepare d - its a huge hotel, lots of people, but I think only 3 lifts, so dont run out at the last minute, you may have to wait for a lift, sometimes i just used the stairs.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!!!!”
Reviews.Author: sobearies
Reviews.Content: This hotel was 1 block away from N. Michigan Avenue, which has very nice shops and coffee shops. It's also located walking distance from Navy Pier and Millennium Park. Our room was clean. The bed too small. The bathroom was TINY, but functional. We checked in the weekend after Thanksgiving. There was a big convention taking place in Chicago, called the "RSNA". There were people from all over the world staying at the hotel. The first thing I noticed when I walked in the room, was a very strong and nasty smell of cigarette smoke. Yughhh!!! I called front desk and a housekeeping person showed up immediately and sprayed the entire room and bathroom. However, when the scent of the spray wore off, the cigarette smell came back just as strong. I covered the vents in the bathroom with a towel, and still I was getting the smell. It was so bad, I couldn't sleep that night. The next morning, I personally went to the front desk and complained. The gentleman at the front desk was very honest, apologized, and told me there was nothing that could be done, other than to call security, to possibly find out who the smoker was. I was later told that the hotel is non-smoking, however, some guests decide to take liberties and break rules, thus ruining other people's stay. It's sad that because of these unruly people, I must give an average review of the hotel. I review hotels based on if I had a comfortable experience or not. In this case it's a negative :-( However, I must acknowledge that it was not the hotel's fault. We had issues with the internet in the room. This was a major issue!!!! The wifi in the lobby did work and was free, but it's nice to be doing work in your room, instead of in a busy lobby, or having to walk all the way to a starbucks. The room had a flat screen TV, but I couldn't work it out to watch regular programming. The room amenities included very good tasting coffee, shampoo, conditioner, soap bars, but no shower caps, so bring your own.

Reviews.Title: “Great accomodations for Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: DrJustino
Reviews.Content: Even though we stayed just one night, I wanted to compliment this hotel and its great staff. The location is great, just a half block east of Michigan Avenue. Arriving at rush hour on the Wednesday before Thanksgiving, there were A LOT of people on the streets. Alan greeted us warmly and even conveyed a bit of humor, as I told him it was crazy outside, he said "I assure you, we are very sane in here." He was friendly, and even took a moment to find out about us, which you don't necessarily find these days. He upgraded our prepaid Queen bed room to a King corner suite on the 17th floor, which he did at no charge, since the hotel was not full, and it was around a holiday. It seems there is a lot of variability in room sizes, but we found the King corner room to be VERY spacious, and overall one of the nicer rooms we have stayed at in quite some time. The heating/cooling unit had some difficulty maintaining a set temperature (e.g. you set it for 68 and suddenly it is 75 degrees in the room), but the room never felt too hot or too cold. The bathroom is somewhat small, which many people seem to gripe about, but it is more than adequate for what a bathroom is--a tub/shower, toilet, and sink! I found it cute, and it was definitely clean and updated. There are 3 elevators that are smaller, 4 person elevators, but it didn't seem to be an issue in terms of access, except for certain times of the day (e.g. mid-morning and checkout time). There is a great Lavazza coffee shop that is connected to the hotel and opens at 6:00 a.m., and they serve breakfast and lunch sandwiches, among other things. The most striking thing about our stay was when we were leaving--the housekeeper thanked us for staying there, and that is something I have NEVER experienced at a hotel before! Compliments to all the wonderful staff!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent staff, very tiny room”
Reviews.Author: DonnaW
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Inn of Chicago over the Lites Festival weekend and wanted to comment on our stay.Â Â  Overall, we enjoyed our stay.Â Â  Location was important and this hotel had a good one.Â Â  We were able to get a fairly competitive rate for our room only days before the festival.Â Â  Although we had some issues, as noted below, the positives were more important and allowed for a good visit.Â Â  As long as you understand what you are getting up front, we would recommend the hotel to others. Â Â  Cons:Â Â  The room was rather small. Â  It had a Queen sized bed which was just big enough to block the dresser drawers from opening. Â  This was not an issue as we only stayed 1 night.Â  But, if anyone wanted to use the dresser, they would be out of luck. Â Â  The window heater/AC ran but it had to be set to 85 degrees to get the room to an acceptable temperature.Â  I was glad that is was not very cold that night.Â Â Â  The elevators (3 of them) are rather small making it hard to fit more than 4 people on them (with no luggage).Â Â  And, on the morning of check-out, it was almost impossible to get an elevator as they were all in use.Â Â  We were glad to be on the 3rd floor and used the stairs.Â Â  The location was excellent.Â  It was on Ohio, just east of Michigan Ave.Â Â  The staff was friendly and very responsive.Â Â  I called to get a missing TV remote to have it delivered to our room in 5 minutes.Â Â  Check-in was fast and we were able to get into our room early- around noon.Â Â  Check-out was also fast.Â Â  We were able to check our luggage for later pickup and the valet chased down a cab for us.Â Â  They also have an elevator to the rooftop on the 22nd floor which affords excellent views of the city. They did serve hot cider and cookies in the lobby after the parade.Â Â  This was a welcome treat after walking up and down Michigan Ave to see the sights.Â Â Â  There was a simulated fireplace in the lobby with comfortable couches/chairs for sitting.Â Â  There was also a bar at one end of the lobby.Â Â  They also had a small coffee shop at the other end.Â Â  And, if you needed different coffee or donuts, Dunkin Donuts was right across the street- as was Baskin and Robbins.Â Â  Our room, though small, was clean, comfortable and quiet.Â Â  The bed was soft and blankets light but warm.Â Â  It did have a coffee maker but we did not use it.Â Â  There was a desk and chair in the room.Â Â  Overall a good experience as long as you are willing to accept the few negatives.:)

Reviews.Title: “Make sure to talk with Veronica at check in and Bob at check out.”
Reviews.Author: Brian J
Reviews.Content: When my wife and I arrived at the hotel we asked for an early check in and got it straight off, but we were hoping for a better view than we ended up with. I came back down to the front desk and politely asked Veroncia if she could help us as we had never been to this beautiful city before and she did. She allowed us to switch rooms to one that was better for first time visitors to Chicago. When it was time to check out, Bob arranged to hold our luggage for a while for free and a flat fee cab to the airport with Jesse the cab driver. A hotel is in the business of accomodating. With the right staff they did. We will come back for a longer stay this summer with our kids in tow. Great central location. It was a reasonalbe cab fare to the aquarium. Brian J.

Reviews.Title: “only for location”
Reviews.Author: Aspi123
Reviews.Content: we got this hotel under the surprise deal where you book first and then they reveal hotel. good central location if u dont have car. rooms are small. bathroom has no window or ventilation & is too cramped up. aircon is old fashioned and noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient and clean..”
Reviews.Author: nikkic23
Reviews.Content: My friend and I enjoyed our stay here. We have all good things to say about it except the bathroom was small and I would have liked a microwave for popcorn. Other than that, great price, great location and comfy beds.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Wildflower8872
Reviews.Content: We just returned home from an overnight stay at the Inn of Chicago. There were some pros and cons but you will have that with any hotel. The Inn of Chicago is located just a half block from Michigan Ave and walking distance to the Hancock Center and Water Tower. We arrived at 11:30am and our room was ready so we were able to check in three hours early which was wonderful! The room was clean and large enough for our needs. We had a very nice view out of our 19th floor room! The only con for me was the comfort. The sheets were quite stiff and the pillows were too hard for my liking. Also the water pressure from the shower head was weak. All in all it was a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and the Right Price”
Reviews.Author: worldtravellers7
Reviews.Content: My partner and I have just got back from a short stay with Friends. We booked 2 king rooms. I was wary of the staffs attitude because of reviews on here but, they could not have been more different. We checked in with Simeon who was lovelly, I asked for an upgrade as it was my partners Birthday and he gave us 2 different suites to look at before deciding. We decided on a king size bed suite with a seperate living area which also had a connecting room for our friends. We loved it as it meant that we could socialize in the living area, as we just left the connecting doors open, perfect! We were also given complimentary in room wifi, i also asked for a fridge for the room, which arrived within minutes of being there - great service. ROOMS - The rooms were clean, the size was fine even the one our friends were staying in. Yes the bathrooms are small but not being funny what do you want to do in a bathroom? The decor could do with being updated to come in line with the reception but it was still fine. The bed was comfy, the aircon unit kept the room warm once I worked out how to use it, making sure I never got cold. LIFTS - There are 3 lifts and we waited no more than a few minutes maximum for one, so it must not have been as busy while we were there. The lift music is something that could also do with being updated, but thats just nitpicking! STAFF - We booked tours through the concierge, they were straight on the case and had us booked within minutes and gave us discount.Bonus! The staff gave us some great tips on places to eat for breakfast, not disapointed at all. We did not have one bad experience, all staff were always polite and couteous. LOCATION - It is one block from michigan avenue and based half way down - walking distance to hancock/water tower and the river the other way. There is a bus stop at the end of the block aswell which meant we could just jump on with our 7 day CTA pass.Tthere is a BaskinsRobbins and 7/11 across the road for all your convienience needs. OVERALL- I would fully reccomend this hotel to anyone wanting a decent hotel, at a good price in a fantastic location, close to all the shopping! We have all said that when we come back to Chicago we will be staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “good bang for your buck”
Reviews.Author: happyfishdivers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Inn of Chicago in Nov of 2011 and were happy enough with the experience. We'd booked the room on a bidding website, so we did not pay their rack rates. For the rate we did pay, we got good value. Yes the rooms and bathrooms are small, but you chose not to stay at the Ritz for a reason. The beds were comfy enough, in-room temperature control was perfect, the restaurant recommendations and directions given by the staff were top notch. The lack of free in-room wireless was compensated for by the convenience and pleasantness of the bartenders in the lobby bar. We didn't experience any instances of noise from anywhere around our room (on the 10th floor), and found the elevators to be perfectly fine - albeit small-door'd. For people looking for a Chicago experience that will not empty the wallet, I would readily recommend this hotel. The value and location far outweigh the size of the sink (a comment we noticed repeatedly in other reviews). And seriously, what are you doing in the sink that requires so much space? Shower in the shower.

Reviews.Title: “OK in a pinch”
Reviews.Author: groovyrogue
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was semi-clean with evidence that it hadn't been cleaned thoroughly in quite some time. There was a line of dust all around the room where the vacuum brushes couldn't reach. there was also dust in the nooks and crannies of the aging furniture. The bathroom was super small and dark with no fan. I had no control of the heat in the room and the temperature was cold all night even after I turned it up. I had to put towels over my blankets to stay warm. The clock didn't work and there was no cable, only analogue tv channels that went in and out of reception.... There was free wi-fi internet access but only in the lobby. Had to pay for AT+T access in my room for 10$ a day that was suuuper slow and quit several times. Location was perfect but this place could be so much more... Staff was ok in my 3 interactions with them, but they didn't go out of their way to ensure I was satisfied. The best thing about my stay was that I could leave my baggage there all day even after I checked out.

Reviews.Title: “Better Than Expected”
Reviews.Author: aspens
Reviews.Content: Location obviously was terrific and only concern was size of room and bathroom and overall comfort. My wife and I arrived early, just past 3 PM and got a large room with the requested two beds (room sizes vary according to previous reviews). Bathroom was indeed small but fine for a two-day stay. Beds were decent as well and service was great. We walked to Millennium Park and Navy Pier and there were more restaurants in the area than one could possibly decide on. Parking is VERY expensive so best not to have a car or return a rental car at downtown locations that are only a few blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: momx4WI
Reviews.Content: Very convient location...right off Michigan Avenue. Small, no frills rooms/small beds ..... no problem for us since we did not spend much time in our room. We had to wait quite awhile for the slow elevators since the "Plant Show" was on and many exhibitors/guests filled the two slow elevators with their plants...no biggie. The BEST surprise was the roof top garden where you could byob (on a weekday) and enjoy the beautiful chicago views. Hopefully the hotel has caught on to the non-hotel stayers enjoying this rooftop and bringing and cranking their own music also:-(! We got this hotel for a good deal through a "name your own price" site!

Reviews.Title: “Average...”
Reviews.Author: 4j1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Inn of Chicago for 5 nights in October 2011 for business. The best description I can provide is, "You get what you pay for." The hotel was clean, but old. I reserved a king room, but when I arrived they stated they did not have any. The rooms were small and the bathroom tiny. Ended up in a room with two full size beds. (I do not believe thay have any double queen rooms because the rooms are too small.) The bathroom sink was 12"x12" with no counter space. The rooms have individual window heat/AC that has an electronic temp. control that kinda works. Set it at 70 once and an hour later it was 74 in the room??? The first day the tub did not drain at all. Stood in 4 inches of water at end of shower, a half hour later there was still 3 inches of water in tub. Called housekeeping and it was fixed that day. Friday night I was awakened at 2am as the bar across the street closed and 25-30 people partied for the next hour. Street noise was very loud. A co-worker in another room came back to his room after the next day to find his key card not working. The front desk stated he had checked out??? It took him 30 minutes to convince the clerk (the same one who checked him in the day before) that his room was pre-paid for 5 nights and all his belongings were still in the room. What was that all about? The front desk was helpful and polite, and the bellman was helpful with a cab when needed. The hotel is one block off Michigan Ave (Shopping) and there are lots of places to eat in the area. The hotel is also a short walk (1/2 mile) to the Navy Pier. It is a great place to visit and shop. I would not stay here again. I would pay a little more and stay at the Marriott or Sheraton nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good value”
Reviews.Author: London_UK_member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here while in Chicago on business and the location was very convenient for meetings but also for enjoying the city in the evenings. The room was a generous size, while the bathroom was compact (but not at all small by European standards!). Helpful staff and good to have free wi fi downstairs.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location - no major issues..”
Reviews.Author: Morrie21
Reviews.Content: The Inn of Chicago provided myself and 3 friends with a superb location in Chicago while we were over for the Bears-Vikings game. Just yards from Michigan Ave this hotel is right in the heart of the city, close to all the action. As we arrived our room wasn't ready but the receptionist gave us a card to get $10 off a meal at the pub round the corner which we did. On returning from the meal our room was ready (we booked 4 in a room to save money and although not perfect we managed fine as the room and bathroom were a good size.) The room was clean and comfortable, the bathroom likewise. Other impressions I got of the Hotel were that the maids ran an efficient service and the bell-hop/concierge service was very professional. Thanks to the concierge guys who booked us on the Untouchables tour and sorted our limo to the airport. I'd also recommend having a look at the 22nd floor roof garden. Very impressive. The only negative thing I have to say is regarding the elevator situation. There is only 3 small ones which seem to be slow moving and this can lead to a bit of waiting around during busy times but apart from that I'd highly recommend this Hotel to anyone travelling to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Rude staff! NOT impressed!”
Reviews.Author: Kantny
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for business/pleasure and I would NOT recommend it again. When we first got there we were unable to check-in because it was before 3 pm and even though we were exhausted from our 6 am flight we killed time walking around the city. We went back when we were able to check-in and the front desk staff got us in to our room after putting up a $50 deposit on a seperate card that they said would stay pending until check-out for things like room service or movie rentals, I was unaware of this charge but had no problem putting up the deposit. We got our things settled in to our room and rested for a couple hours and decided to go out and get some dinner. Upon our return to the hotel a few hours later our key cards did not work in the door to our room. We went downstairs to inform the front desk and were told there was a problem with the company card I was using to book the hotel. I am appalled that when there was an issue with the card instead of trying to contact me and get it worked out they just deactivated our key cards with all of our stuff still in the room. As I sat at the front desk on the phone with the card company the front desk staff was very rude and not very willing to help me straighten out the issue. The lady on the phone asked if she could speak with the front desk staff to get this issue resolved and the front desk staff said "no, I can't talk to them because I am not a manager." I then had to ask the front desk staff if they could go get the manager so they could talk to them. Meanwhile, my husband offered our personal card and asked the front desk staff to run it for ONE NIGHT so we could get some rest and deal with the company card issue the following morning. The front desk staff ran our card and said it wouldn't work. We found that odd because our card should have more than accepted one night at this hotel but there was nothing we could do. After a 45-min. fight I got things straightened out with my company card and we were finally allowed back up to our room. The following morning we got a call from our bank wanting to approve a charge for ALL 4 NIGHTS at the hotel! We immediately told them we would not approve that charge because we had already put it on my company card. On top of the nightmare on the day we checked in: -Our "city-view room" was a room with a window that had the wall of another building 10-ft. in front of it. If you went to the far left-side of the window and looked all the way to the right you could see a few more buildings. -The elevators were slow as molasses and had awful music playing in them, another hotel guest that we didn't know referred to it as cruel and unusual punishment. -There was only wifi in the lobby and they charged $10/day if you want it in your room. -The sheets on the bed felt like a mixture of plastic and paper. I woke up every single time my husband rolled over and rustled the sheets. -The tv is set on a dresser that is so low to the ground you can barely see it over the end of the bed. -The hotel staff said nothing about the Skyline Terrace...the only reason I knew about it is because I looked it up before we got there. Granted the location was good with it being very close to shopping and restaurants and the concierges were always very helpful I would not stay in this hotel again nor would I recommend that anyone stay at this hotel. I saw way too many hotels in that area and think you can get a lot more for the amount paid at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but prepare for service below the average”
Reviews.Author: mapny
Reviews.Content: I have reserved the room from this hotel through Bank of America Chicago Marathon event organizer so I expected the hotel will be prepared for people who will come to hotel for the marathon that guests want to rest as much as possible before the D-Day. Little that I know, this hotel won't let anyone check in before 3 p.m. Since there were a lot of people coming for the marathon, at 3 p.m. there was a long line for people to check-in. I went on to check-in at check-in time and was told that my room wasn't ready, ending up checking in 45 minutes later. Next day I came back to the room after my marathon around 1 p.m., again my room was not ready. I have to wait until the housekeeper finished her job. I thought maybe she came to clean up my room later than others. At 7 p.m. I came back to my room and heard the housekeeper was still knocking at rooms nearby asking to get in to clean the room. I think it was too late. People who were on the same floor as me were marathoners. I'm sure that everyone wanted to rest by that time. Room size was average and it's in good location. WIFI is only available in the lobby and very slow. You need to pay about $10 a day for in-room WIFI. No breakfast was included in the package. I believe you can get better deal staying at other hotels that this one comparing services and amenities. There are several hotels in a bigger chain in the same area. Shop around.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: IsmH
Reviews.Content: It is NOT a 3 star hotel, more of a 2 star -Extremely rude front desk staff, both over the phone & in person; dirty room, old medication capsules on the carpet; filthy ironing stand;sheets feel like they are made out of plastic- they will NOT give you a room 30 seconds before 3pm - even though its a stone throw distance from the magnificent mile- there are plenty of other hotels to choose from, and we will never be staying at this "hotel" again.

Reviews.Title: “the best we had so far in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: fossilizer
Reviews.Content: It was our fourth visit to Chicago as tourists and our fourth hotel in the city. On previous stays we were at the Ohio House Motel (low on comfort, great on parking), the Wyndham Blake (not up to its marketing), and the Belden-Stratford (very nice place, but not in walking distance to downtown); this time around the Inn of Chicago had a great offer through Skoosh.com, and we are more than happy with what we got for our money! First of all, the location is as good as it gets in a city this big. Next on the list of things you like to experience at a downtown hotel is an efficient and competent service. Big â€œcheckâ€� with the Inn of Chicago. As for the corner room we were given, it was not only clean, quiet and spacious, it was tastefully furnished and decorated and very well appointed, too. We stayed for four nights and had a wonderful time at the Inn of Chicago. We will return!

Reviews.Title: “Check your room for leftovers!”
Reviews.Author: bigamm
Reviews.Content: Our friends had reserved some rooms at the hotel for their wedding guests. The ceremony and party were held at another location, so this was just a place to stay for one night and extend the party after the wedding was over. We checked in just before the bus came to pick up the guests and didn't have time to check out the room. We put our bags in the room and left. After the wedding, we returned to the hotel and I went up to the room to change shoes before heading to the lobby bar with the other guests. While in the bathroom, I noticed a used plastic cup in the trash, which seemed unusual since we hadn't used any cups. On closer inspection, I noticed there was also a used condom in the trash!!!!! I returned to the lobby and asked my husband to speak to the desk staff and have it removed. That was all they did. We didn't even get another clean garbage bag or an apology. It was disgusting. I was afraid to touch anything else in the room. I will never stay at this hotel again and cannot recommend that anyone else stay here. I

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Clean, but Small”
Reviews.Author: IndyMedic2006
Reviews.Content: This was a nice, clean hotel and close to several landmarks downtown Chicago including Navy Pier. Be sure to check out the rooftop lounge. It provides a nice view of downtown Chicago if you are interested in skylines. I had a room with two queens. There was a nice TV. The room and the bathroom are on the small side. The staff were alittle on the cold side, but they did their job effectively.

Reviews.Title: “inn of chicago”
Reviews.Author: best0fluck
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent ; the magnificent mile. Within walking distance of all the top chicago attractions ( ie within 2-3 miles of the Shedd aquarium, museum of natural history, solder field, buckhingam fountain, hancock and sears tower, navy pier , lakeshore drive, mc cormick place. Rooms are decent. The front office staff: particularly Mr Alan : are great. dont expect to get early check in. You will be checked in at 3pm only : this is because the hotel is usually booked. The hotel does not have a restaurant but it does have an attached lavazza restaurant. Complimentary breakfast is not there. there are no microwaves in the rooms. But because of its wonderful location and good front office staff it is value for money though the american express outlet near to it has incompetent staff who cause trouble while encashing traveller cheques because they do not know the rules. However the hotel is great and good value for money and there are plenty of dining options nearby within 20 yards radius of the hotel. Overall a very good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints”
Reviews.Author: Steve J
Reviews.Content: The location was really good and the price was right. I have no issues with this place except that the mattress was really soft and saggy. The room size and quality was to be expected for the price and location and the staff was very friendly. I would stay here again. Not a fancy luxury place, but clean enough for the traveler who prefers to spend their money on the actually trip rather than on the bed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Dave59871
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights here on a family trip to Chicago. The location is excellent - in the block just off the Magnificent Mile. This is an older hotel that has been remodeled very nicely but the rooms and bathrooms are small. The staff was excellent. This is a good value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Frankie030
Reviews.Content: Could not be in a better location, staff very helpful, room clean not particually big, hotel would possibly benefit from brighting up with a refit but generally ok

Reviews.Title: “Location was great , hotel was not so great.”
Reviews.Author: kymluca
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great area, close to shopping and nice restaraunts. Upon arrival we were sent to a room on the 14 floor . As we opened the door to the room. The smell horrible it actually hurt my nose YUK!. I made a call to the front desk to let them know , we wouldnt be able to stay in that room. They were very kind and put us in another room on the 16 floor. The smell was better. The rooms are very small!!!!!!!!!!! The bathroom was so small and had only a pedestal sink. There was no where to place anything. I had my makeup bag on the floor! I will make a trip to lovely CHicago again, however I would never stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, good location, but noisy”
Reviews.Author: marcgr
Reviews.Content: I had a room here for two nights while attending a conference next-door at the Marriott Courtyard. Got a reasonably-priced room here (reasonably-priced for central Chicago at least) and it about met expectations. Good: location is excellent, very convenient to the Magnificent Mile. The room was clean as expected, no complaints on that. Fairly standard 3* hotel room bed, furniture and fittings. This is an older hotel (in common with many buildings in central Chicago) and appears to have been renovated multiple times throughout its history. The room was OK on size, I looked on the hotel floorplan and it looked like my room was a little larger than some of the others. The bathroom was very small with a tiny sink and could have used a place to store toiletries, etc. Probably my biggest issue was noise - even being up on the 25th floor and even though the windows are double-paned, the windows don't seal very well and the structure of the hotel and the surrounding buildings seems to reflect noise up from street level, fire and police sirens in particular.

Reviews.Title: “Don't pay extra for the "City View"”
Reviews.Author: TrishaAmber21
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean and comfortable. The location was great! Navy Pier was in walking distance. We were here on our mini-honeymoon. We loved the decor of the lobby and our room. The lobby had real orchids on almost every single table in the lobby. I love orchids so I thought this was a great touch to make guests feel welcomed. However, on the down side I was not thrilled that you have to spend all your time in the lobby if you want to use their wifi. I was not thrilled that we paid extra for a "City View" when we opened the curtain and we were staring at a building. Although the hotel offered to switch the room to a downgraded room with a bath tub we opted to stay in the "city view" room as they called it because it was newly remodeled and more contemporary. The elevators are fine, not quite sure why others feel the elevators were such an inconvenience. The size of the elevator, that you spend literally less than a minute in per trip should be the last thing you complain about. Lastly, on our last night there we were woken up several times by some women screaming in the hallway. Then our last morning there we were woken up at 6am because of housekeeping. Our room was on the 22nd floor right next to the maintenance elevator, which I'm pretty sure this elevator was busier than the lobby elevator was. All in all it was an average experience and I feel it could have been better than it was.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel but crummy room”
Reviews.Author: john h
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights in one of the worst rooms I have stayed in my business travels. 3rd floor, back of the building, 1 small window that was painted shut, and had frosted glass on the outside. One loud AC unit, and a curtain in the corner for a substitute closet. The room was so dark even in the daylight the room lights had to be on - I call it the dungen. After the 1st night I asked to be moved but they said they were full and could move on the last night - at that point it was not worth the hassle. Furnishings, (other than the closet) were ok, nice desk chair (small desk), bathroom was small but nice, low sink otherwise ok. Other rooms might be better, but beware if your room is on the backside of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique-ish hotel only 10 minutes from the lake”
Reviews.Author: RipleysBeliever
Reviews.Content: Great customer service and I was very surprised to see extra towels and refrigerator delivered within a few minutes. They were really on the ball.

Reviews.Title: “disappointed”
Reviews.Author: fussy942
Reviews.Content: Only good thing about this hotel is the location. The room was large enough, but the bathroom was very small. The stool was old and too low, the sink was small and very low. My wife made it a point to use the bathrooms in restruants and lounges when possible instead of in our room. Won't stay again. Much better deals in the city. Stayed on 10th floor and AC ran almost constantly.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting old hotel, BEAUTIFUL rooftop terrace!”
Reviews.Author: bauerjan
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a fabulous trip to Chicago. We chose the Inn of Chicago because of its terrific location and the bargain deal we received. What we found was a graceful old hotel with a modern flair, half a block off of the Magnificent Mile. Our corner room was bright and spacious. The beds were extremely comfortable, the linens crisp and clean. The bathroom was very clean and the fixtures were very modern. The sink was especially interesting. The only disappointment--we arrived too late to really enjoy the beautiful sunset from the incredible rooftop terrace. We also hoped to enjoy our takeout deep dish pizza from there, but it began to rain. Next time!

Reviews.Title: “Great Downtown Location”
Reviews.Author: nelleFlorida
Reviews.Content: We wanted to stay close to Navy Pier, the Architectural River Tour, and pay a reasonable price, this worked for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - clean & friendly”
Reviews.Author: Mark M
Reviews.Content: This hotel we found on line after reading reviews here and elsewhere. For the price - the location simply cannot be beat. It is in the heart of it all and close to everything. The place was clean, very clean. Others mentioned the A/C noise, but we did not notice. It is not central A/C but a wall unit but had no climate issues. The room sadly I was a little disapointed in - clean as a whistle, and like major City rooms, bathrooms were small but expected. The reason for the let down was the rooms did not have the same boutique feel that we expected after seeing the lobby and main floor areas. It felt like what I would expect at a Comfort Inn. They appeared to be recently remodeled too just not consistent and a bit of a let down. THE STAFF HERE WAS AMAZING! Pointed us in a direction everyday and even took the time to point out maps and places to visit! Would return, but may seek out a hotel with a more boutique feel throughout.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Experience I have Ever Experienced!”
Reviews.Author: dpriddy84
Reviews.Content: I am going to make a very long story short... they screwed up my reservation. I spent three hours in their lobby because the manager would disappear for 20-30 minutes each time (IE he went to call his boss and was gone for 30 minutes, I asked to speak with his manager and he was gone for 30 minutes, etc etc). It was ridiculous. I did not stay in the hotel (because I finally walked out of their lobby after three hours), so I can not review the accommodations. What I can review is the management and the handling of the situation. It was horrible. The impression that I received was "prove we messed it up!" I ended up staying at the Courtyard by Marriott that was on the same block. It was fantastic and the staff was great. They even discounted the rate a little bit after I told them what had occurred at this hotel. With all of this said, I will tell you that I manage a hotel, an award-winning and very highly rated hotel. So, I feel that I am knowledgeable in the field and how these types of situations should go. I travel quite often for business and pleasure. I will not be back to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal”
Reviews.Author: OmahaAnn
Reviews.Content: We were a little concerned having read some reviews after having purchased the hotel on Hotwire. We received our room at less than half of what we would have paid from any other website. The room was average in size, clean, comfortable bed and pillow, large flat screen television, in room coffee maker and hair dryer. The soap and shampoo were refilled daily. We never waited more than one minute for an elevator to our 16th floor room as we traveled during the week. The location is excellent, very close to numerous bus lines, about 4 blocks from the subway system, and less than one block from Michigan Ave. The bathroom was not spacious but was large enough for an individual to get around and was clean. A few more shelves to place personal hygiene items would be nice. In comparison, the bathroom was two times larger than a bathroom in a similar style hotel in London, England.

Reviews.Title: “Pay the extra money and get a nicer hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Samscz
Reviews.Content: This was my first time here and it's ok..once arriving here the lobby was alright, I've stayed in higher end hotels in Chicago before but we were just passing by heading back to St Louis and my boyfriend and decided to stay overnight downtown. The rooms are small, no mini fridge or microwave to put your leftovers. The room is small and the bathroom is TINY!! The sink feels like it's in front of the Toliet literally! But what really got me was the hotel bed. Gross. They didnt even put a bed cover on. And the sheets don't even fit our bed they're a size too small and you can see the matters and end of your feet! DISGUSTING. this place is dirty, outdated and staff seem to have a stick up there @$$. Will never come back here again!!

Reviews.Title: “great Location, ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dgoinplaces
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over labor day 2010. Had free hotel points to use. Great location right off magnificent mile. Walking distance to Navy Pier as well (half mile or so). There are better hotel options but it served its purpose. Small rooms, and hotel has some age. small hotel bar in lobby and coffee shop connected. Very small elevators so beware. Nice balcony on upper floor with great views. Have to walk a little ways for dinning options, none onsite.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: foodie01720
Reviews.Content: Based on prevois reviews and the great deal we got from Travelzoo, we booked our stay here. The location could not be more perfect. A block from the mag mile, the CTA, and the gorgeous Ohio St Beach. The staff was polite, and checkin was very smooth. We hot in at 11am expecting to just drop our luggage off till checkin, instead our rooms were ready and we got to freshenip before we started our site seeing. DD, Strarbucks on the same block. Rooms were small no doubt, but it was a clean safe area, and we toured all day so the bed was all that mattered. Roof deck was nice, would not recommend appetizers. Short walk to beach, where we rented bikes and viewed the city from the lakeside bike path. We LOVED this. All in all would recommend and stay again.

Reviews.Title: “One word... DUMP!”
Reviews.Author: jls_spice
Reviews.Content: This place was a utter dump! I was literally checked in the hotel long enough to find another hotel, approximately 1.5 hours. This hotel is awful!!! I wouldn't allow my pet to stay in this place. The floor lamps were bent, the room(s) (I asked to be moved because, believe it or not, the first room was worse than the second) smelled liked air freshener and cigarettes - which caused my throat to swell and my ears to itch. Dump! Dump! Dump! I would presume that a Motel 6 would have been a nicer place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Make sure all 3 elevators r working! Long wait with 22 floors!”
Reviews.Author: Livilain
Reviews.Content: Tiny rooms, tiny beds, tiny bathroom, tiny sink, tiny elevators. Clean, good value, not great for families, rude staff but we didn't have to deal with them too much

Reviews.Title: “Less than Impressed”
Reviews.Author: melissa s
Reviews.Content: Not at all impressed. We booked this place as friends coming to Chicago for the first time. Its location is excellent, but that is all I will give it. We had booked a room with two beds and got here and were told they had none of them left and we would have to share a bed. I like my friend, but not that much! when we told the guy at the front desk we had booked two beds and we also had it on our email confirmation he said "oh those confirmations can be misleading." Um, how so? If I book and pay for something then that is what I am expecting to get. The rooms are TINY and the bathroom is as well. There was hair on the bathroom floor when we got there as well as a massive one in the bathtub and the walls and doors desperately need a paint job. There is nowhere to store anything in the bathrooms. Our bed was VERY soft -so much so that our backs hurt in the morning. The biggest issue we had was the sheet on the bed. It did not fit! I only went to the end of the mattress but did not go over the end. We accepted this for night one and then night two complained. The manager was very nice and had it fixed for us for night two. Night three it was back to the short sheet (they dont use fitted sheets!) and the top sheet had dried blood on it and so for night four I complained again and got it fixed by a woman with no teeth who was shouting at me in spanish! The elevator is TINY so you often have to wait for a few runs to get on one. Especially in the morning as we waited almost 20 minutes for one with our luggage. There are no fridges in the room which I was annoyed about but I guess there is nowhere to put one! The in room iron left a mark on my friends new shirt. They are VERY skimpy on supplies. For two females staying there, they gave us one bar of soap (which we used for the handsink) as well as two small bath towels and a foot towel. This is what I would expect for one person staying, not two. Outside of that, the location is excellent. It is within walking distance of everything you would want to see and do in downtown Chicago. You have to pay for internet in your room but you can use it for free in the lobby. I never had any issues with the speed as it always worked fine for us. the front desk staff in the day were helpful and polite but the evening ones we found to be extremely rude and unhelpful. Overall, if I were to come to Chicago again, I would not stay here as I would want somewhere of a better quality.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: kickitup
Reviews.Content: I was worried about this hotel after reading a lot of negative reviews, but after staying there for four nights recently I can honestly say I don't understand what that is all about. The hotel is in an absolutely wonderful location, right off the Magnificent Mile and within easy walking distance of Navy Pier. My family always felt very safe in this location. The rooms were roomy and clean and the rooftop terrace was especially nice. Now, the last time we were in Chicago we stayed at the Marriott (which is almost directly across the street). This hotel is not the Marriott but we didn't expect it to be. In fact, some of my party liked this hotel better and it does have a certain charm that the big fancy places can lack. Some reviewers have complained about the front desk staff, and while they were not overly friendly, they certainly were not rude and were attentive whenever needed. Other reviewers have complained about the elevators. There are two small elevators so they fill up quickly and often one has to wait, but our wait was never so long that it was annoying. If you go in knowing that you may not get "instant" elevator usage you will be just fine. We would stay at this hotel again without hesitancy and once again the location can't be beat, especially for the price!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: MinnesotaJoElle
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is within walking distance for much of Chicago's shopping, dining, sightseeing, etc. It is close to the excellent public transportation services offered by the city. I checked rates online and found they offered a "parking package" and it included our room plus valet parking. This was a better rate than to pay for parking separately. It is a historic hotel, however, it has 3 elevators and the rooms have been updated. I have stayed in smaller rooms at large hotel chains, and was surprised at how much room we had. The beds were clean and comfortable. Feather comforters and 4 pillows per bed. The air-conditioning worked well. There was one 3-drawer dresser and a nice armoire for hanging clothes. The bathroom was quite small, but it got the job done. You could sit on the toilet, soak your feet in the tub, and wash you face in the sink, all at the same time. There are a couple of shelves I utilized to put our toiletries on, as there isn't a vanity. Toilet worked fine. Hot water and a good shower head. The best kept secret here is the rooftop lounge on the 22nd floor. Patio furniture, sofas, great nighttime views of the city! Our only complaint was that housekeeping forgot to make up our room one day. I called the desk and they said they would send someone. I asked where we should go while the room was being cleaned (9:45pm), they just said it would be taken care of. We waited in the lobby for 30 minutes while the room was cleaned. Upon check-out I mentioned the incident, thinking a discount or voucher for future stay would be nice. No deal. I also thought they missed an opportunity to provide us with drink vouchers for the rooftop, or breakfast in the morning. The service is not why I would recommend this hotel. Two words... great location.

Reviews.Title: “What a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Nanster630
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel blindly through Hotwire and ended up paying close to full rate for a standard queen room. With all the lovely 3-star hotels in the area, we thought for sure this would be comparable--especially based on the images on their website. Not even close. I would give this hotel 2 stars at best. The lobby was tired. Only 2 tiny elevators (a 3rd was "indefinitely" out of order) for a packed house. We ended up using the stairs most of the time. The room was no better. Fragrance sprayed by housekeeping was unable to mask the smell of mildew in the tiny bathroom and something like stale body odor throughout. Requested a king bed when booking over 2 wks prior, but only got a queen when we arrived ("sold out"), which was all this small room could accommodate anyway. Was supposed to be a romantic getaway overnight, but this place definitely didn't create the mood. Disappointing. The only redeeming quality was the location.

Reviews.Title: “Very, very, small”
Reviews.Author: Caelian
Reviews.Content: The location was great! We could step out from the lobby and start shopping! This was a fine hotel, the staff was very nice, however, the rooms, and especially the bathroom, were tiny. There were 2 couples in the room, and I would not recommend anyone stay here with more than 1 other person. In fact, I probably wouldn't stay here again unless the only thing I was going to do was sleep. Also, there was only 1 valet on duty when we arrived, and we ended up having to park our own vehicle. Not a big deal, but self-parking saved us about 20 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Girls' Birthday Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Minn_CaboFanatic
Reviews.Content: My friends and I reserved a few rooms at the Inn of Chicago last weekend for our 30th birthdays. The hotel was conveniently located near many attractions, bars, and restaurants we wanted to see. We easily walked pretty much everywhere --- and I say that as a less-than-adept urban walker. The decor in public spaces is contemporary and cool. We loved the rooftop terrace's ample and comfortable seating (not to mention AWESOME views) and the tasty drinks served up by Dan the bartender. The concierge staff were helpful in storing our luggage and arranging (and confirming) a flat-rate cab to Midway airport. Our room had two double beds, a small closet, small bathroom, and two windows overlooking the city. The room was quiet and spacious enough for three adults to exist comfortably together, and bed was plush enough for us to sleep. The bathroom and elevators were tiny, but workable. My biggest complaints would be that there was no fridge or microwave in the room and having queen beds (vs. double beds) would be nice. All in all, I'd gladly return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value!”
Reviews.Author: galinuva
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Inn of Chicago while visiting area colleges with my teenage son. The location is fantastic! -- only 1 block from Michigan Ave, and only 4 or 5 blocks from Lake Michigan! Our corner room on the 15th floor was quiet, and though the bathroom was small, the room itself (2 double beds) was fairly spacious. (It was huge compared to rooms in similar hotels in New York City.) The beds were comfortable, and I also thought the elevators were actually pretty fast. The hotel was a very good value - same as what we paid our first night at the Hampton Inn at Midway airport -- but in a much, much funner location.

Reviews.Title: “Good, clean room. Great rate. Super location. Friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: TLW6407
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights late July 2011 with wife and 2 college age kids. Friendly staff and responsive valet. Clean room. Decent beds. Small bathroom but clean. Not fancy but rate was lowest in mag mile area even without Hotwire. Great location 1 block from Michigan Ave. Bar in lobby and on rooftop thurs-sat. 7-11 and Dunkin' Donuts across street. With Ambassador East ruined by remodel this could become our Chicago go-to hotel. Been to more expensive hotels that were not as good as Inn of Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Very minor drawbacks, but great location and excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Michael255093
Reviews.Content: I don't understand some of the negative reviews for this hotel. Yes, it is an old building which has been given several facelifts. The bathrooms, though very clean, are cramped. The elevators are small and also on the slow side. However, given that Michigan Avenue is less than a minute's walk from the front door of the hotel, you accept all this for the price (I paid $126 a night - you'll find it difficult to match that along the Magnificent Mile). I was slightly annoyed that the fitted bedsheets the housekeeping staff used didn't quite seem to fit the bed, but I didn't find any of the staff to be "rude" as some other reviewers have. Other than that, the bed was very comfortable, and despite only being in the third floor and having a window facing Ohio Street, there was very minimal traffic noise. Other positives: In-room TV included many cable channels. Wifi was free (but a bit slow at times). My room had its own air conditioning unit which allowed me to turn it off and on when required. The bar downstairs was a great place to wet my whistle during the August humidity. All in all, this was a perfectly acceptable hotel to stay in during my great trip to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “very rude staff”
Reviews.Author: EzHassan
Reviews.Content: do not stay here find a little bit more expensive place ( 20 bucks more or so ). This place has very tiny rooms, rude staff and extremely crowded. Just stay at another hotel that has parking so you can get a discount for the parking, the courtyards next door gives you a 10 bucks off for parking..

Reviews.Title: “Bachelorette Party partied it up!”
Reviews.Author: Cbowsk
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with 5 girls in one room and 4 girls in another room for 2 nights. We had no problem fitting everyone and the price was right. We had a pleasant stay and the rooms were well kept and clean. The bathrooms had no vents so it got pretty hot with 5 girls taking turns with the shower. The AC wasn't working that well in one of the rooms but the other room kept cool. The lobby is beautiful and contemporary style. The elevators are VERY small so don't plan on fitting more than 4 people and their luggage in there. The rooftop deck was gorgeous and fun to take pictures on with all the ladies in the party.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: Marzland424
Reviews.Content: clean room, hotel looks older but well maintained. Location great for mag mile and navy pier.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: Gaelicmom3
Reviews.Content: My son lives in Chicago and we keep trying different places to stay. We really enjoyed the Inn of Chicago. It has a great location and the room was fine since we are never there much. We LOVED the roof top balcony. No one was up there, such a cool view. We got in quite late and my son hated the thought of walking to the subway to head back to his place in Logan Square. I called the desk to ask if we could have a roll away and they delivered it within minutes. The person on the phone was most gracious and helpful. We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for, and this was fine!”
Reviews.Author: Jacqs924
Reviews.Content: I planned a trip with my husband and my parents to Chicago,and paid for the hotel as a gift. Not being rich, I found this for a pretty decent price (can't remember now how much it cost). But way more reasonable than most other places. Yes, the room was a little small, yes the bathroom was small (closing the door to shower was way too hot becuase of how small). But it was inexpensive.
