Everythign was clean, lots of channels on the tv, hotel people were really helpful. Biggest downside - the elevator was teeny tiny and I'm claustraphobic. Plus we were there on a friday night and every club kid in the city and their bottle of cologne kept getting on. But that's not really the hotel's issue. It has a little coffee shop attached which was nice, a dunkin donuts, 7-11, and tea house on the adjacent corners. Walking distance to shops and restaurants. I thought it was just fine for the price I paid. Actually, now that I think about it, the bed was really uncomfortable for me, but no one else in our party complained. I was a few months pregnant, so maybe I was just more sensitive.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable & Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Bigpapi_yankeefan
Reviews.Content: If you want to be in the middle of everything, stay at this hotel. Six blocks to Navy Pier, One block to Michigan Avenue with all the store, five blocks to Hancock building and approximately 15 minutes to beach at lake Michigan.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: DublinFairy
Reviews.Content: we got a great deal on galahotel.com if we were paying full price we would not be happy, the best thing about this hotel is the location, the rooms are shabby, the a/c is noisy and not very efficient I know that there was a heat wave when we were there but is that not the idea of a/c.. The staff were adequate, on two occasaions the terreced bar on the 22nd floor was closed for a private party. If you can get a good deal then this hotel would be fine but dont pay full price.

Reviews.Title: “Check in head ache”
Reviews.Author: jaed49
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here twice. The hotel itself is very comfy and VERY good location. Had a little trouble at check in though that could have been a disaster. We booked our room through our Choice Hotel account, which is in my husband's name. The weekend turned into a Girls Weekend and he was not there when I checked in with my sister. The desk clerk politely told us we could not have the room because his name was on the reservation but her was not here. I understand there is probably a reason for such a policy, but as a customer I felt like I was being told "tough luck." Also, the room was actually a free room because I was using choice points for it. (I travel a lot for work and always stay at Choice.) I couldn't help but wonder if they just hoped we'd give up and go away so they could sell the room. That's how it felt anyway. After several minutes of trying to get the clerk to suggest a solution, I finally asked if my husband could call and give them permission to give us the room. Nope. How about if he calls the head office or whatever and changes the name on the reservation.? Bingo. But we were not exactly given this info, we had to kind of come up with it ourselves. So my husband called, got the name on the res changed and we were able to check in finally. Will I stay there again? Probably! The housekeeping and bell station staff are so friendly and you can't beat the location. The front desk needs some help and maybe an extra person at busy times. The line to check in and out was very long.

Reviews.Title: “OK Place offering value hotel downtown”
Reviews.Author: Jen31373
Reviews.Content: Check in was amusing. I was given a room and walked in on a woman sleeping in her bed. She promptly got up and shut the door in my face and locked it. (Rightfully so!) Considering I had no help with my heavy bag and had to go back downstairs and get another room (struggling with my 50 lb bag w/o assistance) after a very long flight from Tokyo, I found this off-putting. The hotel is right downtown and location is fantastic! It's a 30 minute taxi from O'Hare (w/o traffic). Front desk staff were nice and offered useful info for getting around the area. Rooms are a nice size and have great TVs. Hotel is conveniently near trains. This place is great for visiting Chicago. You really can't beat the price! I would've given a higher rating had I received help with my bags and didn't have the whole check-in fiasco.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place to Stay for Navy Pier and Shopping”
Reviews.Author: markrobstl
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located just off Michigan Avenue. Navy Pier is an easy walk...5 or 6 blocks. We really enjoyed walking around the Magnificent Mile. This hotel is right near the center of the shopping area. Don't miss Yolk for breakfast/brunch. It was about a 5 minute walk. Also, the hotel has a nice rooftop bar. I disagree with some of the other reviews on the hotel condition. Although the bathroom was very small, it was usable...besides, who spends their vacation in the bathroom. The room was very clean and the bed was comfortable. I do agree with other reviewers about the elevators. There are 3 of them and 2 are very small, so there was usually a 3-4 minute wait to use them. That was the only negative I had about the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Staff”
Reviews.Author: beam4888
Reviews.Content: I had an awful experience here; the housekeeper didnâ€™t clean my room the second night and the front desk didn't have the courtesy to call me back when I tried to explain the situation! The front desk staff seemed to have this glassy stare to them and when I attempted to get some sort of reaction it was full of attitude. I wrote the hotel after my stay and never heard back.... it's been 4 months! Beware of being fooled by the nice lobby furniture (it's actually really cheap looking in person)- this hotel is NOT worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Good location rooms are a bit out dated”
Reviews.Author: ST61938
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a few days for work. The location is great on Ohio between michigan and st Clair, right off mag mile. There is no room service, and the elevators are inconsistent as they lights and indicators don't always work. The bathrooms are a little older and the window ac units are a little loud. However the rooms are clean and the service was very nice and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value at great location but cramped”
Reviews.Author: MadisonGrog
Reviews.Content: Got a good price for a great location, just a block off Michigan Avenue on Ohio. This is an older hotel so the elevators are small and the rooms seem smaller yet. If you are somebody who likes to spread out your "stuff" in the bathroom, forget about it. No counter space to speak of. This didn't bother me for a one-night stay but if you care... My companions complained that the wifi was slow. Bottom line: if you are looking for an OK place to crash while sight-seeing in Chicago, this is a great place. If you are looking for a romantic weekend or "spa experience," keep searching! Oh yeah, parking was $36 a night, I believe. I came in by train/taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely small rooms at a great location”
Reviews.Author: roadcrazy1980
Reviews.Content: Good: Excellent location Clean rooms Nice terrace open for everyone. Great way to spend time after dinner. Bad: Rooms are the smallest I have ever seen. Next to only a very crappy hotel in Rome The bathroom is very cramped. Cramped is an under statement. The wash basin / sink is suitable for maybe a small monkey. That thing is a joke.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel.....”
Reviews.Author: Travelmonster2011
Reviews.Content: The location is great close to everything nice top roof bar just steps from great stores, and train station......... i will definetly be back.....

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: AmazingAd
Reviews.Content: Overall a lovely hotel, we had just gotten engaged and they upgraded us to a corner suite, lovely huge tv and nice views out the window. two double beds which were really comfortable. bathroom really clean but could do with a facelift. Excellent excellent location. great for shopping and clos to timmy o'tooles!!!

Reviews.Title: “NICE HOTEL RECOMMEND STAY”
Reviews.Author: JOHN H
Reviews.Content: This was the second hotel we stayed at during a convention in Chicago. I highly recommend this hotel. The lobby and bar area is very clean and greeting. Our room was clean, spacious (standard room) and ready on time. The hotel is close to several restaurants and bars, shopping and for us, one block to our shuttle bus stop. Our room price/value exceed our expectations, especially in light of the hotel where we stayed the night before. That hotel wasn't bad, but this hotel was cleaner, more modern and about $20 bucks cheaper per night. We didn't like the wi-fi fee so we tethered my cell phone for Internet access; come on hotels get with it, This is an excellent opportunity to add value to your brand! The only other thing was my wife would have loved a tub but we didn't want to pay extra for it. Enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “The Good, the Bad and the Ugly:”
Reviews.Author: simommy
Reviews.Content: The Good: Location! Location! Location! The Inn is on a great corner surrounded by fantastic restaurants and shopping. It was an easy 10 minute stroll to Millennium Park. The lobby was lovely and the desk staff very helpful, professional and friendly. The beds were comfortable with clean sheets and plenty of pillows. The Bad: The rooms were indeed small. The bathrooms were snazzy with marble tile floors and pedestal sinks BUT there was no place to put ANYTHING - including your toothbrush and even shampoo. Perhaps adding a shelf beside the mirror would help. It was a hassle to have to have to constantly unpack your toiletries for every single use. Also, the Wi-Fi connection in the lobby was spotty and did not work in the room at all despite my willingness to pay the daily fee, a real problem if you need to do work. The Ugly: The room was never cleaned. When we first checked in, I found beer caps on the window sills. The second day, I came back to find a giant wad of used towels on the floor next to the bed - not all of them ours! The third day, I returned to find the contents of the coffee maker soaking the table top. And on each day, the maids showed up at 8AM. Once, they actually walked in while we were still sleeping?!? And a word to the wise, get there early for check in because the Inn â€œroutinely overbooks.â€� We watched two people get turned away despite having reservations. Good luck finding another room during convention season. All in all, not the worse but certainly not the best.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money they charge!”
Reviews.Author: FlowSanAntonio
Reviews.Content: Rooms small, noisy, elevators small and worst of all, my daughter develop a rash on arms, shoulders, back and stomach. We thought bed bugs, still don't know what it was, but will never stay at this hotel again nor any from the Ascend.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good for the location”
Reviews.Author: yellowplum
Reviews.Content: Cleanliness can be better but acceptable. Rooms are small but the price and location cannot be better. (booked with expedia with flight package) It is right on magnificent mile.

Reviews.Title: “In the Heart of Downtown”
Reviews.Author: I_wanna_go_places
Reviews.Content: I found the inn to be somewhat dated, but the location was prime restate. There are other hotels in the area that would have been just as qualitative in the location. The lobby was really cool, but the rooms and the elevators were very in need of updating. All in all it was an o.k. stay because we were hardly in the room at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Good rooms - Old building”
Reviews.Author: fay_fay4
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nothing like the website. That said, it isnt a bad hotel. Just dont expect to see what you see on their website. My room was spacious, clean and the bed was extremely comfortable. The bathroom was a good size, you're either sitting or showering - you don't really need it to be the size of a dance studio. The staff were extremly helpful. Nothing beats the location - right off Michigan Ave. I got a great price for the room so it was a great value for me. The elevators and the halways are old. It's an old building. But that didnt bother me. There was a pharmacy right outside, a supermarket. Only bad thing is, my room was next to the staff elevator - it was very noisy. I was too tired to change my room after a 17 hour flight. But i suppose i could have asked for it to be changed.

Reviews.Title: “The Adequate Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fellowtraveler1011
Reviews.Content: The good thing about the Inn of Chicago is it's location. Also, they promptly fixed the sink faucet which was squirting water at us when we used it. But the service and amenities here were sub par. The rooms are small, the beds are small, no fridge or microwave, and it's an older hotel, but I expected all of that. What I didn't expect: We left the room in the morning and came back mid afternoon to find our room had not yet been cleaned. This happened both days of our three night stay. So we had to hang around in the lobby until the cleaning was done, which I hate to do when I'm tired and just want to relax. Our shampoo, soap and (plastic) cups were never replaced. We got one bar of soap for four people for a three night stay, which we had to swap back and forth between the shower and sink. We finally snagged one off the housekeeping cart just so we could have one for the shower and another for hand-washing. As I said our dirty plastic cups were just left there with no replacements. We never had a box of tissues, just an empty tissue box cover. My husband and I went for a drink at the bar and the bartender asked my husband if he could put our drinks in plastic cups, because he was "almost out of glassware." Um, NO! If we're going to spend $16.00 for two drinks, we'd like an actual glass! We've stayed in many downtown hotels that were about the price of this one, and have had much better experiences.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value Find in the Windy City”
Reviews.Author: simonr78
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel and got a really good deal on the room. I was so very impressed with the refurbishment the friendliness of the staff and the overall feel of the hotel. Whoever re-designed this hotel has done a wonderful job. I would whole heartedly recommend the hotel on location and value.

Reviews.Title: “A nice place, at a nice price, in a great location”
Reviews.Author: wagamamanekoTO
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed there for a week while I was in Chicago for a conference. The service was excellent; the concierge and doorman were particularly helpful. The room was the standard size for a business hotel, and the internet was free in the lobby. The location was quite convenient in terms of shopping and entertainment, and it was helpful to have a 24 hr Duncan Donuts and 7/11 literally across the street. If you are the kind of person that needs to be pampered and tends to try to order things that are not on the menu in every restaurant you go to, this quaint, comfortable, nicely-located spot may not be for you. On the other hand, if you regard yourself as a regular sort, then I highly recommend this hotel to you.

Reviews.Title: “Downtown Chicago at a real value!”
Reviews.Author: Flynlo
Reviews.Content: First time staying at the Inn of Chicago (a Choice Privileges partner) and I must say I was really surprised. Located right downtown, close to Garrett's Popcorn, Giadonno's Pizza, McCormick and Schmick's Fine Seafood, and of course the Magnificent Mile. About 5 blocks from the lake and walking distance to Navy Pier. Check in Service was outstanding, VERY courteous and professional. Hotel is in a traditional old Chicago building, but well kept, with a very comfortable lobby to relax in. Elevators were very small, as in a lot of old buildings, so don't bring your steamer trunk. Room was clean and roomy enough, with a nice workspace. Bathroom was small (think cruise ship small). Pool and Hot tub were very nice, Workout room was nice but limited to 1 each on equipment so get there early or late to avoid waiting. View from roof nice. Concierge was knowledgeable. Price was UNBELIEVABLE for downtown Chicago. Only downsides: 1. Bathrooms were very small. No shelves or places to sit toiletries at all. Would recommend this addition. 2. Concierge: While helpful, hard to find. We had to go find him 3 times as he was literally NEVER at his station. I'd recommend some type of paging button for him, or an automated concierge screen with recommended restaurants, printable maps, site seeing tours, etc. 3. Elevators: room for 2 with luggage. 4. As a businessman, having free internet in the lobby only is a turn-off, and I'm totally opposed to hotels charging 10 bucks a night for in room internet. Otherwise a great stay, and I don't think you can beat the value.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, Small, Nothing Like Their Website”
Reviews.Author: Excentrique
Reviews.Content: Not sure where to start. First I suppose we got this hotel for us through one of those money saving websites that gives you a quote but doesn't tell you which hotel it is. When we saw it was this one, we were excited b/c the website looks quite nice. The only nice, upgraded thing about this hotel is the lobby. The first room (first, we'll get to that later) was tiny, not ventilated and I could barely fit into the bathroom at 5'4", 109 lbs. (I don't mind small rooms, this was ridiculous). The heater didn't work, the window didn't even open a crack, the decor was tasteless and old. In the morning after the first night, we found BLOOD, dried blood that had been there for god knows how long on the blanket. We obviously complained and the manager gave us drink tickets (!? to a bar that wasn't even open). We demanded to move - so they put us in a bigger room down the hall. We had heard partying in that direction the previous evening but didn't think anything of it - until the next day we felt the wet spots from carpet cleaning (vomit cleaning?) and vomit all over the curtains behind the desk. The room had been cleaned so well that bottle caps from the previous night's party were in various areas of the room. At this point we were so fed up, we complained again. To management's credit, they asked the internet site we booked on to refund our money, but obviously we would have rather had clean rooms and pay full price. We will never return there and we will not be recommending this hotel to anybody!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the money”
Reviews.Author: LucyEths
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location. Not too far from the subway and walking distance to everything you want to see and do. The rooms are definitely a little shabby but you get what you pay for. The walls are pretty thin but that didn't bother me since I am a heavy sleeper. If you are literally only going to use the room for sleep, I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Stay of My Entire Adult Life!”
Reviews.Author: Quietbeauty1
Reviews.Content: I am stunned. When you look at the website and reviews for this property, you are left with the impression you would be staying in a clean, well appointed boutique hotel. Nothing could be further from the truth. The room I was assigned was not just small, but small to the point where I honestly believed I was on a hidden camera show! The bathroom floor was filthy and the tile was not completed and had a lip at the door jam I kept tripping over. There was NO VENTILATION in the room with the exception of a small vent on the wall in the tiny bathroom that I soon discovered was not a vent but merely a hole that led to the adjoining room! They could see in my bathroom and I could see in theirs! What! The room was next to the on-site gym, so I had to listen to the treadmill and other exercise equipment. Half of the television channels didn't work. The heating system was loud and obtrusive. The lights in the wall kept flickering and were in need of being changed. The mirrors in the room were like fun house mirrors. They seemed like cheap distorted mirrors that were of no use. The room itself was unclean and looked as if it was crawling with bed bugs. The bath tub tiles were caked with soap scum. The location of the hotel is ideal and the price for the room was low. The front desk staff are incredibly friendly and professional, but the room was horrible! If you are the type of traveler where you only care about having a place to rest your head and don't care about surroundings, this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location; nice lobby; great price”
Reviews.Author: Lisamarch
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights for $63 per night - parking was $45 per night, plus taxes...but still great room rate. Lobby and bar is really nice with friendly staff. Check in with FourSquare and you get a free cocktail! Our room was a corner room and fine, except I usually prefer central air, and our room was a window unit...with window units, I'm always worried about mold/cleanliness issues since I have a child with asthma. The bathroom was small, but towels were nice and everything was very clean. Terrace is really a great thing. Location is amazingly convenient. At this room rate, I will definitely be my first choice for where to stay in Chicago on future trips.

Reviews.Title: “Would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: cdbarclay
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 7 nights. The hotel was booked via expedia. I had some reservations after reading some of the negative trip advisor reviews but my wife and I were highly impressed with the amenities. I had asked for an upper floor and at check in this request was immediately acknowledged and we were quickly assigned a room on the 19th floor. The room was exactly as pictured - very clean and spacious with very comfortable bed and flat screen tv. The bathroom was a reasonable size and also spotlessly clean. All staff were extremely friendly and very attentive. When the airline check in printer didn't work it was no trouble for reception to do this for me, when we went to pick up our bags which were stored on the last day the converge interrupted his phone call go retrieve our bags do that we weren't left waiting. This hotel is in a great location and given the rates that we paid I really can't fault it in any way.

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service and good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: sunny30_11
Reviews.Content: All staff were great -- from check-in to maid service -- courteous, accommodating, and happy to help. The hotel's location is excellent, right around the corner from Michigan Ave & close to lots of great shopping and restaurants. We chose to stay here instead of paying twice as much for the hotel where my conference was being held... and we were very happy we did! The rooms are small, but adequate, clean, and well-maintained. We would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME St. Patty's Day weekend at The Inn of Chicago”
Reviews.Author: mschmidl
Reviews.Content: My friend found this wonderful, little hotel online and because of the reviews we read and the price, we decided that we would spend out first weekend in Chicago at the Inn. The four of us had never been to Chicago before so we were excited to see what the St. Patrick's Day festivities had in store. The hotel was in a great location (approximately one block from Michigan Avenue (aka "The Miracle Mile"). The Gap store on Michigan Ave. and Ohio is almost directly across from the Inn. There was Dunkin' Donuts and a Starbucks (both perfect for morning coffee and breakfast) around the corner from the hotel. There was also a 7-Eleven (perfect for us to purchase snacks, booze and water at). We also walked to some of the popular tourist atractions including the Hancock Building, Water Tower Place, Navy Pier, Millennium park, etc. When we were too cold to walk, we took taxis (PS: I think Chicago has the cheapest taxis. The four of us never paid more than $20 to go anywhere, including the tip!). The hotel building itself looks small as it is nestled between buildings. The lobby of the hotel was super-cute, trendy and modern. The elevators worked well and we never had to wait to go to and from our room. Our hotel room had two queen beds and the bathroom was pretty small, but the four of us (yes, four of us) managed to get ready every day and night without any problems. House-keeping was awesome as they cleaned our room every day and took out all of our trash (we were messy as we had Chicago pizza delivered to our room from Gino's). They also promptly brought us numerous sets of towels when we called for them. Lastly, the hotel bar was nice...small, but perfet to grab a quick drink on your way out for the night. The bartender gave us all a round of free drinks when we showed him our check-in on Foursquare. He made a really good pomegranate martini! We plan to return to Chicago for this summer and plan to stay at the Inn of Chicago again!

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME Hotel, Great Location...Will not be staying anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: Lou_Lou84Uk
Reviews.Content: GREAT Location. This is my second visit to Chicago and i previously stayed in the Essex Inn which is alot further down Michigan Ave. This hotel is just a block from the bustle of Michigan Ave and the SUPERB shopping and walking distance to lovely places to eat and the John Hancock building. The hotel is clean, tidy and the staff where excellent...even down to the maid every morning who wished us a good morning and asked us how our trip was going, she was so pleasant..Whoever the maid was on floor 10 ( Didn't catch her name)..she was a jem. As i say we were on the 10th floor and heard hardly any traffic noise. The rooms were comfy and the beds are the comfiest i've ever had in a hotel in all my travels. There's a 7/11, Baskin Robins, Dunkin Doughnuts, Coffee Shop across the street and also a coffee shop attach to the hotel. What can i say, i LOVED my stay and will be staying here next year for SURE :) xxx

Reviews.Title: “BRILLIANT!! Certainly be staying here everytime i visit Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Lou_Lou84Uk
Reviews.Content: GREAT Location. This is my second visit to Chicago and i previously stayed in the Essex Inn which is alot further down Michigan Ave. This hotel is just a block from the bustle of Michigan Ave and the SUPERB shopping and walking distance to lovely places to eat and the John Hancock building. The hotel is clean, tidy and the staff where excellent...even down to the maid every morning who wished us a good morning and asked us how our trip was going, she was so pleasant..Whoever the maid was on floor 10 ( Didn't catch her name)..she was a jem. There's a 7/11, Baskin Robins, Dunkin Doughnuts, Coffee Shop across the street and also a coffee shop attach to the hotel. What can i say, i LOVED my stay and will be staying here next year for SURE :) xxx

Reviews.Title: “Rooms look nothing like pictures online”
Reviews.Author: wtmarlowe
Reviews.Content: I have just checked in and will be here for 4 nights....great location but rooms look totally different that what is represented on their website!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Great Staff & Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Tanmay
Reviews.Content: We loved the hotel. Staff were very friendly. They gave us free internet and a drink coupon free. They were helpful in guiding us how to get around Chicago. It is a tall tower. We reached from Anchorage via a flight in the afternoon. Rooms here generally do not get ready earlier than 2pm, so reach after 2pm. But the rooms were very comfortable, spacious and the beds were large, clean and comfortable. After a long flight from Anchorage, we needed to sleep well. We had a sound sleep. The location is in the magnificent mile, close to the Navy Pier. However, the downtown is slightly far but not too much. Well connected to bus stops, which are within walking distance. Many shops and restaurants nearby, also walking distance. Grocery store - Seven Eleven was just opposite the hotel. Giordano's deep dish pizza restaurant was also closeby. Recommend to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Smokey and poorly managed”
Reviews.Author: SharlaHolladay
Reviews.Content: The first night was uneventful, check in was smooth. The elevators are tiny, and the rooms tiny, halls are dated....but that's ok since we got the room for $70 a night....If you are from NY you won't really mind the space, if you are from TX....maybe you will think it's tiny too! :) Bed and bedding were great. But the real problems began the second night when the people in the room next to us were completely out of control. We had to call down three times because of them running, screaming and jumping. THEN - 5am someone started smoking. I called down around 6 to see if the front desk could please do something about it, but I ended up having to call down again a little later in the morning because of another wave of it hitting our room. The front desk staff were nice, but did not offer to let me use some Fabreze or something to freshen the terrible smoke smell and they wouldn't do anything about it. At one point I went downstairs to sit while my husband was sleeping, just to get away from it...and I told the front desk clerk, and she just looked at me, then she said that they are going to charge the guilty party $100....ok.....this does nothing for me. So I called the manager, who was rude, helpless, and really nailed the coffin down for me about this hotel. Simply being apologetic, offering a way to freshen my room and convincing me they were going to do something about it would have calmed me down instantly but instead he was just simply rude and helpless. Having proper management that can deal with a situation like this is imperative for any hotel I would assume...so I wish them luck. Bottom line: loud, small, no free coffee in lobby as advertised, management inept, good location in Chicago, front desk nice, good beds and bedding, if you like to smoke illegally in a hotel room -this place would be great for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to sleep”
Reviews.Author: Apie0402
Reviews.Content: I stayed here overnight for a night out in downtown Chicago. Let me start by saying that I got a fantastic rate and the location couldnâ€™t be better. Ultimately we didnâ€™t plan on being in the room for an extended period of time so it was really just a place to sleep. The lobby is pretty and both the front desk and concierge staff were very helpful. The room itself was outdated and definitely did not look like the picture on the website, but we were fine with it. The walls are very thin. We were out pretty late, but you could hear complete conversation of people walking in the hallway at 2am and which TV program they were watching next door. Would we stay here again, YES for a place to spend the night, but if you are looking for a luxurious hotel room this is not the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: purple_24_24_24
Reviews.Content: Friends and I stayed for a girl's weekend and had a great time! Location was fantastic, room was clean and priced well. Everything within walking distance. The bathroom was a little small, but that's to be expected and we still had plenty of room. Very friendly staff, especially the front desk. Will definitely return on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Rude Staff, Ugly Rooms”
Reviews.Author: caylajean
Reviews.Content: Yes, the location is great, but the staff is terrible. They are very rude and treat you like you are an idiot if you ask a question or don't know something. This was my first time to chicago... and just a head up if you have never been parking is 41 PER night t.... The furniture is very chipped and in rough condition, looks like something that can be found at Goodwill for $20. Wifi is 10 PER computer in your room which was frustrating to me because we stayed two nights so they managed to take another 40 dollars just for me and my boyfriend to be able to use our computers. There is no breakfast and of course, when I asked the lady at the desk looked at me like I was a complete idiot and told me to go to a cafe. WOULD NOT RECOMMEND. I stay at hotels often and this one is at the BOTTOM of my list.

Reviews.Title: “pictures on the website were nothing like the room i stayed in”
Reviews.Author: paterpan
Reviews.Content: Overall the location and price I got on this hotel were the things I was happy with. The lobby was well designed and came with free wifi. In the rooms, you can hear even the faintest chatter in the hallways, the room I stayed in was nothing like what was pictured on the website.

Reviews.Title: “Cute, convenient and affordable”
Reviews.Author: mcenter
Reviews.Content: We stayed 12/28-1/2 and were extremely impressed with our stay. The hotel is so convenient to almost every attraction and shopping! The rooms are small but unless you plan on staying in the hotel all day, it shouldn't be a big deal. The staff is very knowledgeable and strive to make your stay pleasant. We arrived at 9am and were easily accommodated with a room. Overall I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely FANTASTIC ! NO reason at all NOT to stay at this hotel !!”
Reviews.Author: Driver8rws
Reviews.Content: Absolutely FANTASTIC ! NO reason at all NOT to stay at this hotel. NOTHING "wrong" AT ALL. We had the N.W. CORNER room on the 14th floor (rm 1425). The ROOM was 15'x 14', the ENTRYWAY was 4'x 6.5' (with a place to hang clothes). The bathroom that everyone talks about being "SO SMALL" was not THAT small... It was 5'x 6.5'. It DID have a pedestal sink in it and below it is mentioned by the hotel that they are/were replacing the old sinks with pedestal sinks, so maybe we got a newer room ? There was also an 32" LG Flat Panel TV. Looking at the floorplan card in the room it looks like there are 5 corner rooms on each floor that are this same size, (room numbers xx01, xx02, xx05, xx25, xx26), and one that is HUGE corner room suite (room number xx14 ). Yes, 6 corners not 4... The REST of the rooms look smaller on the floorplan... SO just ask for one of the "corner" room numbers that I listed above !! (they may all be KING rooms, ours was) The room and bathroom were very clean. The location of course was AMAZING ! PARKING: The CHEAPEST parking in a 5 block radius is only 2 blocks EAST at 330 E Ohio St. It is the McClurg Court Parking garage. [---] $30/24 hours GROCERY: One block SOUTH and 1/2 block EAST (255 E Grand) is a FULL SIZE Dominick's grocery store. It is REALLY nice, with a huge Wine selection, decent beer selection and lots of produce, bagels, muffins, etc. plus all other regular grocery items and a full drug store. QUICK-FOOD: Within the 1 block around the hotel is Chipotle, Subway, Dunkin Donuts, Potbelly, Pockets, and several other places to grab something quick. I am SURE going to check rates at this hotel EVERY time my family and I go to Chicago !! JUST G-R-E-A-T !! I cannot understand what anyone was complaining about with this hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Not horrible -- but not good either!”
Reviews.Author: lmbryant
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff was friendly, location was great (easy access to shopping, public transportation, restaurants, etc), but quality of accomodations left something to be desired. The room was extremely spartan, and while it wasn't outwardly dirty, it didn't have a really "clean" feeling. The bed was atrocious! Sheets felt like sandpaper, pillows were stiff and lumpy. The price was great, so it sort of made up for the other shortcomings, but we won't be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: playaguya
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 2-night holiday stay at the Inn, Dec. 8 & 9â€¦2 â€œmatureâ€™ but very fit adults. Many trips to Chicago, but our first stay here. A great rate was offered, so we decided to give it a try. The overriding aspect of our stay was one others have already written about â€“ LOCATION. It is EXCELLENT!!! So easy to get to all the to-doâ€™s on our list. Besides being so close to the Mag Mile, it is right in the center of spots to the north and the south. Easy walks to the Water Tower and Hancock in one directionâ€¦then to the Art Institute, the Cultural Center and all of the Loop in the other. Just a few blocks to Navy Pier too. (Loved the stained-glass exhibit!) Really, just ideal for us. As said above, this trip was holiday-themed. We did a lot in 2 days, and especially enjoyed seeing as many Christmas decorations as we could. What we didnâ€™t do was go to Chicago to spend our fun time staying inside the hotel. I honestly couldnâ€™t give you any helpful info about the lobby or the bar, though we saw they have both. We only dealt with 2 hotel employees â€“ the desk clerk and the 12th floor maid â€“ and they were both very friendly and helpful. Our room was clean, quiet and comfortable, sufficiently roomy, with new foam-topped mattresses and very inviting pillows and quilts - also an in-room coffee maker, a huge plus for us. As said before, the bathrooms are small, but so what? We easily did all there might be to do in them. (OK, gotta admit - sometimes we laugh at certain criticisms here on TA, and this was one of them). One more thing about the quiet â€“ we always travel with earplugs for sleeping in case thereâ€™s noise â€“ we didnâ€™t need them at the Inn. We both slept very very well. The one criticism we would offer is that there is no â€œbusiness centerâ€� with the usual free computer access. We donâ€™t travel with laptops. To wrap it up, it was cold outside during our December stay, and our room at the Inn was a welcoming place to come back to. Weâ€™d definitely stay here again â€“ and weâ€™ll do just that when we come back for a Valentineâ€™s celebration in February.

Reviews.Title: “A Fabulous Find in Downtown Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: docsurglace
Reviews.Content: I am glad I finally decided to stay at the Inn of Chicago. I visit Chicago quite often, and have seen this hotel before on other trips to the downtown area. I found a great deal on Hotels.com so I decided to try the Inn of Chicago for my next business trip. WOW!!!! This hotel is certainly a hidden gem in downtown Chicago, and is a quick half block from all the excitement, wonderful shopping and restaurants of Michigan avenue. So, you can't beat the great location. I was also impressed by the decor (very modern and chic, but not stuffy and snooty like some upscale hotels can be.) When I arrived, the staff was VERY helpful and friendly, and checking in was a breeze! They offer free wi-fi in the hotel lobby, but you must pay $9.95 (for 24 hours of access) if you want to have the convenience of wi-fi in your hotel room. In terms of parking, the hotel does not have an attached parking garage. But there is a parking garage located around the corner (very short walking distance) where guests can park for $41 (valet) or $36 (self-park). They also offered a FREE wine and cheese managers reception on the night I arrived! The room I stayed in was very nice. I must admit the room was a bit small (certainly not a shoebox!), but could easily and comfortably accommodate two people. There was ample storage/closet space, a nice-sized desk, and flat panel TV. The only downside to the room I stayed in (in my personal opinion) was the view (small window in room) and the small size of the bathroom. I stayed on the 19th floor and had a view of the neighboring condo building across the street. But, I could still see portions of the magnificent mile down below. Likewise, the bathroom was quite small (reminded me of being in Europe), but was still very functional, and again, the decor was very modern. If you are a person that needs and/or likes a lot of bathroom space, then you should probably consider another hotel. Overall, I had a wonderful experience at the Inn of Chicago. I wish I would have stayed here sooner during my many trips to the windy city! But now I know better, and I would certainly stay here again. If you are planning on visiting downtown Chicago and desire a charming and trendy hotel with great service then the Inn of the Chicago is for you!

Reviews.Title: “Smaller Rooms Typical of Older-style City Hotels. Close to Michigan Ave.”
Reviews.Author: Tuxmiller
Reviews.Content: Decent lobby area with open seating areas and reception area. Small, awkwardly set bar area that contains noise, especially when the bartender has the TV volume too loud. Check-in staff was sufficiently informative, but not the friendly smiling faces a traveler normally encounters in this very friendly city. The elevators are very slow. The rooms are fairly small. The bathroom are older and small. The location, a 1/2 block off of Michigan Avenue, on Ohio, is fantastic for being downtown. Close to downtown businesses and shopping. Beds are made up with just sheets, which is kind of strange. They are comfortable enough, but nothing to write home about. There is not restaurant, so no room service. And I hate it when hotels charge for internet service, which they do @ $9.99/day. But you can get free wi-fi in the bar and lobby areas. Like the Rafaello, whether or not you choose to stay here should be dependent on how great of a rate you get.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: MadaleineB
Reviews.Content: Service from the concierge was great, she is VERY knowledgeable. Room was a decent size, clean but the dcor could be updated a bit. The coffee place downstairs was great. The BEST part about the hotel was the location which is central to everything. Also a decent value. Roof top patio is also pretty nice. Check out West Egg for breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: Gerry1971
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located about 100 metres from the Magnificent Mile, room was very big and the service was excellent..They even DHLed some luggage that I'd left behind to me in Ireland. Good Hotel Great Service..

Reviews.Title: “Good Value - clean,simple hotel”
Reviews.Author: mmw77
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I (in our 30's) wanted to go see a concert downtown one night and didn't want to spend a lot of money on a hotel - but wanted something clean and in a good area. This was PERFECT! Easy off the highway and parking within a block of the hotel. (don't valet - the walk is less than a block and saves you $6) Very simple rooms - but clean and bed was comfortable. Flatscreen TV. Small Bathroom - but fine for the purpose. Could use just some "looks" fixups in the rooms - chipping paint,dings, etc. But very clean and welcoming. We had a basic king bed single room and found it perfect. Will stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Best Kept Secret in Chicago!! Great Service!! Super Clean!!”
Reviews.Author: LaniO84
Reviews.Content: i dont think i can think of one bad thing about the inn of Chicago.. The minute we arrived a man came out right away for Valet and anothe rman was right there to get our luggage and open the doors for us! Chilvary is NOT dead!! we were greeted with a welcoming smile at the front desk and was escorted to our rooms right away by a bellman..we were on the 11th floor so we had an amazing view!! The rooms were cozy..not luxurious by any means but enough not to complain.. Flat screen television and down comforters!! Yay! soft towels with great complimentary Girly stuff.. lotion, soaps and a AESOME scrub bar..and the next day when i asked a housekeeper for another one bc they were That good..she gave me a handful! AWESOME!! great top deck with a breathtaking view of the city.. nice bar downstairs with friendly bartender..All in All..GREAT experience.. Loved going down to the super trendy/cozy lobby with a cup of coffee and check my email with their Free Wi-Fi.. too bad it wasnt in the ooms too though!

Reviews.Title: “good choice”
Reviews.Author: VagabondCND
Reviews.Content: I was happy with this hotel. the location is excellent, room was nice, bed was comfortable. The room could have used a better cleaning. As other reviewers have noted, the bathroom was exceeding small, made worse by a poor vanity choice. Noise is audible from bathroom, but I didn't have issues in the room. A small bar downstairs, Lavazza espresso bar attached, tea shop across the street. Internet charges, but there is free wi-fi in the lobby, in the cafe, and in the tea shop across the street. Hotel seems to be popular with 'weekenders', so it isn't always the quietest place - but one would not expect quiet along magnificent mile. There are many good restaurants very close by. This is an excellent choice, especially if you get a deal. Full price is a bit steep for the room quality. No complaints.

Reviews.Title: “An unexpectedly delightful stay!”
Reviews.Author: embracethechaos
Reviews.Content: I was a bit leery of this hotel having read reviews going both ways, but I got a good deal on Orbitz, so went ahead....and it was one of the best business trip hotel experiences ever. The service was not just expert, but actively friendly. I came in harrassed and grumpy from the airport after a day when nothing went right, and the staff said--"We need to make your day better!" and upgraded me to a nicer room. The room was downright elegant--dark woods and seagreen accents. It was so comfortable I hated to go out, but when I did need to the staff gave me great recommendations on finding a great steak and a reasonable printer. Stopped for free (and good!) wine at happy hour before heading out. Had a lovely nightcap on the open rooftop terrace. With a fantastic location, great prices, extremely comfortable beds, and an all-around wonderful staff, I can't see why I'd stay anywhere else in Chicago after this experience. Usually I shop around for price, but it would now be worth it to me to pay a little extra to come back to this jewel. I almost hate to let the secret out....

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location for shopping and sightseeing.”
Reviews.Author: Vivien97
Reviews.Content: Although this hotel has a splendid location, we found the staff to be at best efficient and at the worst, officious and unfriendly. Our impression was that their hotel would always be sought after, due to its location, therefore it was unnecessary for them to be welcoming, as is usual in most American hotels and motels. The bellhop was the exception and he provided courteous and friendly service. There are plenty of restaurants within easy walking distance. We particularly liked RB's in State St near Hubbard for dinner. A choice can be made to eat in the dining room (very nice ) or the pub. Breakfast is excellent at Yolk on the corner of McClurg and Grand or West Egg 620 N Fairbanks. For live music in a classy atmosphere, the Redhead bar is only a short walk in W Ontario St and there is no entry charge, although there is a smart/casual dress code.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: zorbathegreat
Reviews.Content: we found a gem in this hotel. the location is perfect. its right beside the magnificent mile(shopping) and close to all tourist spots.Staff very friendly and helpful. they do not have a restaurant but it is not a problem as there are so many in Chicago (although so many we could never decide :)). the reviews about toilet and room size are true but it was not as bad as people made out we could move around no problem and the bed was very comfortable.Only slight problem was that the wifi in lobby is free but you have to pay for it in rooms which was a bit annoying. if i ever make it back to Chicago i would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good price and location”
Reviews.Author: econotraveller41
Reviews.Content: If you are visiting Chicago and seeing the sights and taking in the city this is a decent place to stay. It is not spectacular but at the price and location, it is hard to beat. My wife and I liked the room OK but we didn't spend a lot of time in it anyway. We could stay in at home but Chicago was waiting for us! We had an issue w/ our a/c unit being way too loud and I did not sleep well at all the 1st night! It bothered me that I may have a couple of more days of this but upon reporting the issue to Veronica at the front desk, she promptly took care of getting maintenance on it! By the time we returned to the hotel, the a/c was fixed and we were able to enjoy the remainder of our stay. As far as some of the comments I have read I can only say one has to judge for themselves. I would stay here again and if saving some $$, getting out, and convenient location is your thing, look no further. BTW-I was in Chicago for a trade show a week prior to moving to this hotel. I stayed at a major chain. The rooms there were small and the walls-paper thin for $250+/night so take your pick..you get what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location within walking distance of everything downtown”
Reviews.Author: sibeed
Reviews.Content: For the price (we used Hotwire), this was a great deal. Super clean hotel. Small rooms and bathrooms, but updated. One of our rooms had a very noisy window air conditioning unit that needed repair. Only a block away from Michigan Ave! Beautiful rooftop outdoor lounge area (see picture).

Reviews.Title: “Best value I've found on the Magnificent Mile!”
Reviews.Author: detwingman
Reviews.Content: I booked on Priceline for $70. Regular price for my King room was $129 which is still a bargain for the location. Nice little Euro cafe attached to the lobby that has a coffee bar, bakery and gelato. There is a parking structure attached to the hotel so you can save a couple dollars vs. valet if you don't mind carrying you bag. The toilet didn't look completely clean but that was really the only complaint I have. The lobby is not huge but there were still people there enjoying drinks and conversation every time I walked through. Stay here if you are going to enjoy the sites of Chicago and just go back to the hotel to shower and sleep. If you like to hang out at your hotel lobby, stay somewhere else and spend $300/night.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: KristySprouse1966
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Inn of Chicago and the location and value is incredible. Just one block off of Michigan Avenue and in the center of the best shopping ever. The room are small but compared to hotels in big cities they are quite comparable to them all. The staff was very welcoming and did everything to make you If looking for a hotel in Chicago in the center of it all , this is where you want to stay. I will be back hopefully sooner then later.

Reviews.Title: “Great rate for location”
Reviews.Author: gendei
Reviews.Content: I booked this on Priceline for $70.00 for a Wednesday night stay; the listed rate was $120.00 and up. The lobby is beautiful and very swanky; if you had clients meeting you there you would not be embarrassed, just don't take them up to the room ;). and the location is perfect, just a couple blocks from Michigan Ave. Cant beat the price. The actual hotel (not the lobby) is worn and older but clean. The room was simply but clean except for the toilet was not as clean as it could have been but for the price I could not complain. You can park valet for $41.00 or park literally next door in the adjoining building for 37.00 per 24 hrs. There is a Starbucks attached as well. There was no problem getting cabs right outside the door. It was quiet and there is a coffee maker with coffee in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel if you can get a deal”
Reviews.Author: JMH2010_10
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice when you walked in. But the guest rooms are very small and out dated. The bathrooms are very tiny. If you are bigger in size in any way, you may not fit in the bathroom. I read reviews about it before I went, but I didn't think they could be that bad. They really were that small though. The temperature in the room was hard to adjust, but at least the heat/cooling unit was quiet at night unlike other hotels. If you can get a good deal on the hotel it's okay, but I wouldn't pay full price for it. Great location though.

Reviews.Title: “Good Area, Very Shabby Accomodations, Decent Price”
Reviews.Author: TravelfromNYC
Reviews.Content: Most of the reviews on TripAdvisor about the Inn of Chicago are spot on. I was leery to book our stay here after reading them but, given the great location, tried them out anyway; for the first and last time. I'm not a particularly picky person when it comes to hotels, but for the price we paid, the way the hotel and rooms are portrayed on the hotels website and the downtown location I expected much, much more. The lobby and main areas are fine but as soon as you step into the elevators the experience goes downhill. There's clearly no care or TLC put into maintaining the building or rooms. The elevator carpet is worn, paint chipped everywhere, and hallways REEK of old smoke and dust (just replace the carpets). The rooms are, in a word, appalling. If you're expecting even a hint of luxury you will NOT find it here. It was the kind of room one would expect to find at a roadside chain. Small, dark, old, chipped furniture all of which showed it's age. The exterior windows were so dirty it was almost impossible to see out of one of them. The guest spaces need total refurbishment. The bathroom was tiny, the small sink was a joke and the bath products, again, are consistent with a roadside chain. The only saving grace was that the bed was comfortable. As one other reviewer put it - installing some glass shelves and a flat screen does not a high-end hotel make. That sums up the guest room experience. I appreciate guest services getting back to fellow reviewers here to thank them for comments or suggest calling the front desk about problems on their next stay but the issues with this hotel can't be fixed by guest services. The space needs a major overhaul. The location can't be beat but, for my money, I'll stay at a nearby hotel and enjoy the time I spend in my room. At the Inn of Chicago, I couldn't wait to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Best location and price”
Reviews.Author: Phoenix91
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 4 nights in a double bed room. The room we stayed in was large and comfortable. Its location is excellent and price is reasonable. I definitely recommend this hotel. It has an outdoor roof on the 21nd or 22nd floor with sofas and tables which was relaxing with the view of Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy beds in a great location, but somewhat shabby.”
Reviews.Author: anneski76
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last Thursday - Sunday. I attended a business workshop on Friday, and my hubby and I stayed through the weekend for leisure. Check-in was smooth and fast, and the staff were courteous and knowledgeable. The lobby is nicely decorated in a contemporary style, but the building sure shows its age once one heads up to the guestroom floors. The woodwork outside our room was so battered looked as if someone had been hacking at it with an ax. On the positive side, I liked the overal design of the room, and the bedding was of nice quality. But there were some serious flaws. The bathroom cabinet was cracked so severely that some of the wood veneer had copletely fallen off. And, although I asked for a nonsmoking room, the place smelled strongly of smoke. We are not smokers and didn't spend any time with smokers during our trip, but our clothes absorbed the smell from the room. When we got home and unzipped our suitcases, the smell of smoke was extremely strong. I had to dryclean the brand new overcoat that I had just purchased that very weekend at Saks. Other positives about this hotel are the location. It was very convienient to Magnificent Mile shopping and attractions. The cafe attached served great coffee, and I never waited more than a couple of minutes for my order. And, again, the staff were helpful and pleasant. Overall, the room was a good value, but the the stay would have been much more pleasant if this hotel made some basic maintenance efforts.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient but...”
Reviews.Author: JKirkman
Reviews.Content: I stayed here because I got a good rate and was near where I had plans to be. The shower, sink and bed sheets were clean, however, the other surfaces (shelves in bathroom, bathroom floor, etc... were filthy. There was no pad or pen in the room (which I needed to scratch a note down quickly and ended up using my newspaper and eyeliner â€“ as my pen had run out of ink), nor the "do not disturb" sign which I did manage to get from one of the cleaning staff. The front desk employees were flat out rude (3 of the 4 times I had to interact with them) - for the exception of the young man who checked me out. Cleaning staff and door staff all very polite and greeted me with a smile and were always helpful. I hope that this was a one off and they were having a tough week, otherwise I would look elsewhere. I will recommend based on location and rate.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Karule
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at the Inn of Chicago and it was a most pleasurable experience. The loacation is great, one block from Michigan Ave. I travel to Chicago quite often for leisure and usually stay in an upscale hotel. When I found the Inn of Chicago online I decided to check it out. While this was not my usual lodging, I was very unsure of what to expect. However, the hotel more than lived up to my expectations. The entire hotel staff from reservations, front desk to housekeeping is the most accommodating and customer service friendly that I have ever encountered at a hotel or resort. The hotel has 22 floors and I always request a top floor, my request was met with a room on the 20th floor, with barely any noise from the city. The hotel offers 3 elevators, so it was not a delay in coming or going. My king room while not spacious provided adequate space. While my sisterâ€™s connecting room with two queens was a little tight. The rooms are very new and clean and the bed linen luxurious. The bathroom linen was thick. The only down side of the room is the bathroom. I certainly smiled and had a laugh when I saw the miniature bathroom. The smallest I have ever seen. If a large bathroom is important to you, this is not the hotel for you. Especially if you plan to have more than 2 people in the room and if travelling with children that require assistance in the bathroom it is not the hotel for you. The bathroom is tastefully decorated with glass shelves on the wall for storage. The desk and mirror in the bedroom provided a vanity makeup area. If you are looking for ambiance whatever the hotel is lacking in bathroom space it makes up for with the wonderful deck on the 22nd floor. Sit in a relaxing patio chair or couch and enjoy the views of the city or the sun going down. I have never enjoyed my early evenings in Chicago as much as I did on the 22nd floor patio.

Reviews.Title: “Needs Updating”
Reviews.Author: JBB071
Reviews.Content: We were in town for the Roger Waters concert. I will start with the one positive for this hotel, great location!! As a general item of interest the room we had was very small. The size really did'nt matter to us but thought you would like to know what you are getting. I booked this hotel thinking it was a 3 star hotel. It is a 2 star at best. One of the pillows had a stain and the bed comforter looked dirty. The bathroom floor was not clean. It was warm in Chicago during our stay and we had the AC set as cold as it went. We woke up in the night several times alternating from uncomfortably warm to overly cool. While we could not hear noise from the rooms on either side of ours the hallway noise was another issue. The doors to the rooms closed very hard and loudly. This sound carried into our room. Upon checking out there were 3 people behind the counter two of which were doing nothing. Yet we waited a while for anyone to look at us and help us. A flat screen TV thrown in the corner and a new Sink and shower head do not a 3 star hotel make. I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best, but could definitely be worse”
Reviews.Author: MerridithD
Reviews.Content: The location for this hotel could not be better. That is the number one reason to stay here. Literally steps away from most of the major attractions, shopping and restaurants in the heart of Chicago. The room was clean. Staff was friendly. Concierge was helpful. Bathroom was tiny. (My 6 foot tall husband had to sit sideways on the toilet to avoid hitting the sink with his knees). For what we paid, it was a good value. Rooftop terrace (22nd floor) is nice, but not a great view. Definitely a no-frills hotel. Our room didn't even have guidebook in it. Just the bed, dresser, desk and a flat screen TV.

Reviews.Title: “I'll stay there again”
Reviews.Author: hahaterri
Reviews.Content: No frills but great location, clean and quiet. Other reviewers have complained about the size of the rooms, but ours had room for a queen bed, desk, dresser, 2 end tables, and a comfortable chair. . Hotels across the street cost twice as much.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: KundK2003
Reviews.Content: It was our first time at this hotel. Arriving from Europe at O'Hare it was easy to get there even by public transport (train, bus). The most convenient bus stop just s one block away. The location is great - not only due to Michigan Ave around the corner and Navy Pier in walking distance. Check-in: Fast and efficient (check-in staff could have been a bit more friendly though) Room: spacious and clean Bath room: spacious enough for us and clean Room service: Daily and efficient/effective Staff in general: friendly and helpful Check-out: smoothly. The well hidden secret: the terrace on the highest floor. Great views, comfy chairs ... and the feeling of being in a theatre in the evening. We look forward to our next stay at the Inn of Chicago We will definitely go back to this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: nnmlopez
Reviews.Content: After reviewing numeorus list of hotels in tripadvisor I decided to stay at this hotel .. what a pleasant surprise ! I had a room king bed and the room size was much bigger than hotels in NYC .. yes the bathroom was small but it was updated and always clean .. we really do not stay or lounge at hotels as we go all over town. What was the best was the location .. one block from Michigan Ave and the number of restaurants in the area really madeit a great vacation. It is also a like fifteen minutes walking to the peer where everything is happening . For breakfast I suggest you go the West Egg ( couple of blocks) just ask the desk in the front for directions. We went to Frontera Grill and followed the advice of others of going in at five and getting your name on the list....we did not have to wait as we decided to eat at the bar .. which is my type of place .. We also ate ate at Webers Grill and Texas from Brazil ( this is an all you can eat meat place, what attracted me was the salad bar ,,which is excelent ..cost per person if $45..but if you are a big eater the food was very good. We also ate at Ron of Japan and we were pleasently surprised as well as a small Tai restaurant after Ron of Japan that was really good. Tip: We bought our GO CHICAGO on the internet for three days and what I liked is that it included everything imaginable museums, bike rides, 3 sailing trips .. for $97 per person so it is the way to go .. For the night entertainment we went to Chicago Blues .. it is vey small and just a place to drink and hear blues ..the music was fantastic so we had a great time ..fee was $10 per person what a bargain for great music ! We also went to a jazz place nearby and entry was 15.00 with live music.. Last time I had been to the city was like over 20 years ago ..what a rebirth !!

Reviews.Title: “Hidden GEM! Amazing Location!”
Reviews.Author: wingslogo84
Reviews.Content: There are hundreds of places to stay in chicago, we got an excellent rate online and I didnt think it would be to bad. The place is right off of michigan avenue. Its within walking distance of everything great that chicago has to offer. If you drive a car, thats ok its close to a great parking garage too. I didnt know what to expect but its so close to all the shopping and sights. The room i had was a little small, the bathroom was tiny but most importantly...very clean. We rested very well.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Lucciia
Reviews.Content: The hotel needs some renovation, but the room is quite large. The bathroom is too small.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great terrace”
Reviews.Author: bertismo
Reviews.Content: The room wasn't very big but it was very clean and comfortable. Being located in downtown Chicago there is a lot of noise coming from the street, but I think it is inevitable if you want that location. And the location is great, really close to the Magnificent mile... The hotel has a terrace in the 26th floor with some tables and chairs. Beautiful place to have something to drink at dusk...

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: shonie29
Reviews.Content: Great location! We were right in the center of everything. The malls were literally across the street from our hotel. We did not need a rental car for anything! Awesome location! I think the hotel staff were very nice, accomodating and courteous. Very nice lobby however the rooms could use more work. The elevator was only big enough for 3 people not even including their luggage! The hallways smelled like urine and the hotel is very old. I did not like the hotel but loved the customer service I received. When we reported mold in our bathroom ceiling we were given another room which was a lot better than the first one. The Inn of Chicago is not a bad hotel just not my preference when it comes to hotels. If you are only staying in town for a few days it fine but I wouldn't recommend for an extended stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: rubydove
Reviews.Content: We stayed here recently for our first trip to Chicago. Our room, though not huge, was spotless, the bed was comfortable and the bathroom was clean. I was amazed at how quiet our room was considering the location. The roof top deck is especially beautiful at night. The location was great, we were able to walk to so many things and cabs and buses are readily available. I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Value”
Reviews.Author: fairness4all
Reviews.Content: I was so confused by the conflicting reviews, I called to see if there were 2 hotels. I booked with some trepidation. I needn't have and I'm hoping that I can save you second thoughts. The hotel location was outstanding, The bed was exceedingly comfortable. There was a great 27 inch flat screen TV in our double double room. I have long curly hair, so water pressure and a decent showerhead are pleasant surprises. My expectations were surpassed. The water pressure and volume were great. Overall a fantastic experience and great value.

Reviews.Title: “What a surprise!”
Reviews.Author: Sej144
Reviews.Content: For the price we paid, it was a fantastic hotel! Location: the hotel is located just off the Magnificent Mile, which big shops such as Guess and Forever 21 being right around the corner. The John Hancock Tower is just a couple of blocks away. It is on the other side of Chicago to the museums, but Chicago is very walkable. Room: our room was quite spacious. It was clean and had a modern furnishings. There was a large TV with a range of channels and the bathroom was of a decent size. There is no complimentary wifi directly into the room, but there is complimentary wifi in the lobby. We didn't have a view of anything through our windows, but it was still quite light and airy. Hotel staff: the staff are on a whole friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location trumps small bathrooms”
Reviews.Author: recorder
Reviews.Content: We got it for a good price and only used it to sleep, shower and regroup. The bathroom is too small and the wooden vanity pedestal made it hard to even get in or around in it. However we were steps from breakfast, late night snacks, meals, Magnificent Mile, river etc. It worked good for us.

Reviews.Title: “Not that Bad, Great Location Great Price..Book IT!”
Reviews.Author: BritSuchALady
Reviews.Content: I heard a lot of negative things about the Inn of Chicago, so I was a little apprehensive. I booked my hotel on Hotwire so I had no idea what hotel I got until I booked it. When I got there I was surprised. It was nowhere near as bad as portrayed. The staff were exceptionally friendly, the lobby was well decorated. Yes they have small elevators and small bathrooms, but I didn't come to chicago to stay in elevators and bathrooms. I came to party with my boyfriend and have fun. For that location ( a superb location ) the hotel is the best price, you are not going to beat it and it is not a dirty shanty hotel. My room was clean the bed was comfortable with air conditioning and a nice TV. It isn't the biggest hotel room I stayed in but I don't mind being close to my boyfriend. Ask yourself why am I coming to chicago? If you are coming to have a good time choose this hotel why pay ridiculous prices just some unnecessary frills.

Reviews.Title: “Inn of Chicago - Par Excellence!”
Reviews.Author: Susan_Powers_2004
Reviews.Content: My friend and I planned a two night trip to Chicago to attend a concert and sightsee and chose the Inn of Chicago. Upon arriving at the hotel, we were very pleasantly greeted. The hotel lobby is very modern and contemporary looking. Our room suite was clean, spacious, contemporary, had wonderful bath products, the most comfortable bed and had excellent views. The 22nd floor outdoor seating area was absolutely gorgeous at night. You can purchase a cocktail at the lobby bar and take it up there with you. The hotel is within walking distance of all attractions. All staff at the hotel were very courteous and accommodating. If you need transportation back to your airport, they will be pleased to make reservations for you. They booked a very comfortable ride back to the airport for us. On our next trip to Chicago, we will definitely stay at the Inn of Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: GaHike
Reviews.Content: Great location, comfortable beds, relatively clean. Downsides - rooms too small, work out room too small w/ not enough equipment. No swimming pool or complimentary coffee in lobby.

Reviews.Title: “OK for a few days”
Reviews.Author: astroboy82
Reviews.Content: We had a wedding in Chicago and needed a decent hotel for 2 days. The Good The Inn of Chicago was the best priced at the best location. A block from the famed Magnificent Mile. About a 15-minute walk from the metro station. There's a gourmet cafe serving Italian coffee located in the lobby and a 7-11 across the street. They had free WiFi in the lobby (the InterContinental where our friends stayed, did not have free WiFi) The staff were friendly and efficient. The Not So Good This was no 5-star hotel. We knew that going in. Normally I take photos of the hotel rooms and post them. This time, I was unimpressed and didn't bother taking any. The room needed some TLC. It's true, the rooms are small and the bathroom even smaller, like a closet. You can sit on the toilet and brush your teeth at the same time. For 2 people, it felt cramped. A few things to note: located near the Magnificent Mile aka Michigan Avenue, there will be lots of traffic in the lobby. There was a baseball game that weekend, so there were a lot of visiting fans. Any hotel located on Michigan Ave will be busy. Second, they have small elevators. You will wait a while during peak periods. So FYI. The A/C was on full blast and was a bit noisy. We couldn't adjust it, but if you're a heavy sleeper, this shouldn't be an issue. So would I recommend this hotel? Yes, if you're staying a few days and the basics are good enough for you. No, if you're traveling with a large family and you want larger rooms and prefer a lavish hotel experience. P.S. If you're visiting Chicago, here are my must-sees: Art Institute of Chicago Millennium Park Architecture Boat Tour A romantic dinner at Table Fifty-Two (Oprah's former chef, Art Smith's restaurant)

Reviews.Title: “what a location and view from the 22nd floor terrace!”
Reviews.Author: flizzer
Reviews.Content: for under 100 bucks I booked this hotel directly with the property.....its a little worn but clean and in an incredible spot! I asked for a room in a quiet area and was treated to a corner room with no neighbors....because of this i had 2 sets of windows and my own view of michigan ave & ohio! the bed was comfy, bathroom more than adequate, great smelling toiletries, nice staff, helpful front desk....who needs more? Lavaaza coffee right next door, einstein bagels round the corner, west egg is a great spot for breakfast right nearby and 2 blocks to the ohio st beach! what a great stay!! the el is about 4 blocks to the west.

Reviews.Title: “Lobby makes promises that guestrooms don't deliver”
Reviews.Author: Icarus922
Reviews.Content: I had high expectations based upon the trendy, boutique-like lobby. After the ride up to my room in a surprisingly small elevator, I was disappointed with dingy, poorly lit corridors that did not look as if they had been updated. My room was smaller than expected, and the bathroom was so small that the sink vanity was only about a foot or two away from the bathtub and only about 6 inches away from the front of the toilet. I would have overlooked all this had the room been recently updated, but everything seemed tired- the wood on the vanity was peeling away, the shower tiles around the faucet appeared partially caved in. The front desk staff was pleasant (aside from giving me a non-functional key at first) but I was, overall, quite let down by the entire experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very mediocre”
Reviews.Author: Kristina11180
Reviews.Content: My mother and I just got back from a week in Chicago, and while the city was gorgeous, this hotel was not. The lobby was decorated tastefully, but the rest of the hotel looked dated. The carpet in the hallway of the floor we stayed on was stained pretty bad, the room was small (especially the bathroom) and the floor was uneven. I was annoyed that there was no binder with hotel information like there typically is in any hotel room. I was equally annoyed about the wifi situation. The hotel advertises free wifi in the lobby, but I could not access it at all during the weeklong stay. Though most of the staff we encountered at this hotel were friendly and helpful, one woman at the front desk had a pretty bad attitude and was overheard getting snarky with other guests checking in on this particular day. The hotel, however, was in a nice location. The shops on Michigan Ave. were only a block away and Navy Pier was only a short distance on foot. Many restaurants were also within walking distance, as was the cultural district. While Inn of Chicago certainly wasn't the most expensive hotel in town, I feel it wasn't worth the price, especially considering the price of parking.

Reviews.Title: “Could not have stayed at a better place!”
Reviews.Author: handhnh
Reviews.Content: Overall, this was one of the best hotels we have stayed at, especially for the price. The location could not possibly have been better. And the price of $90 a night (with 4th night free) including tax that we found at a discount website was unbelievable for an inner city Chicago hotel. Some of the reviews I read that spoke of the staff being discourteous concerned me, but everyone we dealt with could not have been nicer or more eager to please. The hotel is not one of the new, sterile ones but it has old-world charm that we love and of course the room/bathroom were not big, but the one we stayed in at the Plaza in NYC was possibly even smaller. The maid did a wonderful job cleaning it and fluffing up the sumptuous quilt every day. We asked for a top floor and were given the 21st floor out of 22 although there is no view due to Chicago being a city of huge skyscrapers. And do not miss the roof top on the 22nd floor. Only disappointment was the charge of $10 daily to access the internet although it was free in the spacious lobby.

Reviews.Title: “My second stay, and it was as great as the first!”
Reviews.Author: zoohouse
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Inn of Chicago this past weekend for one night. It was my second time being there and I thought (based on reviews) that maybe I had just really lucked out the first time with an awesome room and wonderful service. But nope, I didn't luck out. Everything was just as great as the first time! The location is hard to beat for the price you pay. It's so close to the red line station, TONS of great restaurants, Navy Pier, and Michigan Ave. shopping. Our room was spotlessly clean and I really don't know what people are talking about with tiny rooms. I thought ours was roomy and beyond comfortable. The bathroom is admittedly small but certainly not anything unmanageable. The beds are superbly comfortable. The only complaint with the room is that there is a tiny step up into the bathroom that I kept tripping on and one of our friends (staying in a different room) actually bruised his foot on it. But that's it. The front desk was efficient and friendly quickly taking our bags in the morning so that we could head out to our Cubs game. Check-in was fast and the staff was very helpful. And that terrace on the 22nd floor is AMAZING! They say they close it at 10:00 p.m. but both times I have stayed it has been open well past midnight. We were able to get drinks at the bar and take them up there for a lovely view while we enjoyed our nightcap. For the price we paid, I would have expected less. It exceeded our hopes for our stay. If you want to stay at an affordable, stylish, comfortable hotel with easy access to everything, this is the place to be!

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: MissSarahK
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I traveled to Chicago for a tattoo convention (he was working, I just tagged along for fun). I'd never been to Chicago before, so we went down a day early so I could see the sights and be a tourist. He stayed at Inn of Chicago last October, so we decided to stay there since he knew the area. The guy at the front desk instantly recognized him, which made us feel quite welcome. We were offered a nicer room at no charge since we were only staying one night, and as it turns out, we were charged $30 LESS than the price for which I originally booked the room. Definitely no complaints there! We were given a room on the top floor with a great view. My boyfriend had mentioned that he had a small bathroom when he stayed the first time, but this was not the case on our trip. We had a great bathroom with obviously new Kohler faucets and showerhead. The room was very clean, the bathroom was spotless, the furniture was nice, and the bed was super comfortable! The staff were all very friendly and personable. There weren't many frills, but the location provides plenty to do. My only complaint is the parking ($41 for one night!!!). Like I said, it was my first trip to Chicago, so that very well may be the norm for downtown. As far as everything else goes, we'll definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “I'm so happy I took the leap and stayed.....”
Reviews.Author: Bianca30
Reviews.Content: I was nervous about staying at the Inn of Chicago because of the reviews, I'm so happy that I went with my gut and stayed.......I am a very picky person and the reviews stated that the rooms weren't clean and etc. Sean was nice and changed our room from a queen bed to 2 double beds.
