Our room was small but it was roomy enough for us. The bathroom is small and it does need a vent *wheew* but it was clean and efficient enough for our short stay. The location was great. Oh and the lobby is too cute, the staff was so nice and helpful. Our window was facing a bldg but who cares, we weren't there to look out the window anyway! Yea, I can complain about the little things but I wont because what matters the most is that it was small yet clean.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely renovated older hotel in an ideal location off north Michigan Avenue”
Reviews.Author: efsch
Reviews.Content: The Inn of Chicago is a nicely renovated older hotel in an ideal location and with a pleasant staff. It is on Ohio Street just east of north Michigan Avenue, about half way between the river and the old water tower, in the center of Chicagoâ€™s most fashionable district. CTA buses to almost every tourist destination stop only a block away: #151 to Union station and Lincoln Park Zoo, #146 to the museum campus (Field, Adler, Shedd), #10 (seasonal) to the Museum of Science & Industry and Hyde Park (University of Chicago), and numerous routes up and down Michigan Avenue and State Street. The red line subway station at north State and Grand Streets is just four blocks away, and this connects (usually via stairs) to all the elevated trains, including the blue line to Oâ€™Hare airport and the orange line to Midway airport. A CTA 3 day (72 hour) pass for all the above bus and train and subway routes costs only $14 for unlimited rides. Weekly and daily passes are also available at most train stations and other locations (see the CTA web site). Because older hotels often have variable-sized rooms, we were happy to be given two double beds rather than one king. Our room was about 12x20 feet including the bathroom, and had an armoire, a chest of drawers, a table with two dining chairs (rather than a desk), an LCD TV, an iron and board, and a coffee maker. Coffee packets are complimentary, but rumor has it that the bottled water is costly. Our room was pleasantly decorated and in good condition. We had asked for a room with a view when confirming our reservation, but we were given a view of the fire escape (rooms --23), presumably because we were Priceline.com bidding clients who paid a discounted rate (about 45% below the hotelâ€™s rack rate, and 35% below the hotelâ€™s senior rate for our mid-week-dates). This was a disappointment but not a security problem, because the windows were painted shut and contained wire security mesh within the glass (fire escape access was via the hallway next to our room). Judging from the fire plan, only the larger west-facing rooms have unobstructed views. Other rooms appear to face buildings across the three surrounding streets. But there is a nice open roof terrace on floor 22 for everyone to use. This is a great place to bring a snack and use the free wi-fi (which is $10 per day in the guest rooms). As noted by most previous reviewers, the bathrooms are quite small (about 5x5 feet, less than my arm span in each direction) but are renovated and functional. The one drawback is that the single sink is a fashionable table-top style, but the table extends a third of the way across the bathroom entry. People with mobility or width issues need not apply, and others should beware of stubbed toes. There is no bathroom counter, but there are two glass shelves for toiletries. Most important, bedding is top quality and climate control works well. The beds have pillow-top mattresses with double-sheeted duvets and more pillows than one would ever need. The climate control is a window-unit with digital controls. Since the windows do not open and the weather was cool, we preferred to cool the room each time we returned, then just run the fan on low with the vent open overnight. Because the hotel does not have its own restaurant, room service, or business center, it usually loses a half or a whole star in most booking engine rating systems, but we need none of those. Judging by the numerous tourists staying there (many apparently from Europe), these are not missed. On both sides of the hotel are numerous restaurants, some of which deliver (at prices well below most room service menus). One block east and south is a large Dominickâ€™s supermarket where we got rotisserie chicken, fruit, bakery & deli items, and wine. A few blocks west and north is a Trader Joeâ€™s, for more exotic grocery fare. We usually visit Chicago a few times a year for shopping, concerts, and museums. We will happily add the Inn of Chicago to our options when selecting our hotel in the future. It is not as fancy as the Hyatt where we have stayed in the past, but we were just as happy at the Inn of Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Inn Of Chicago - Great Value, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: DonNewYorkCity
Reviews.Content: We stayed for five nights recently, and we were satisfied with The Inn of Chicago. You cannot beat the location (truly off the Magnificent Mile), close to everything. The minute we checked in (late after 10 pm), the Front Desk Clerk was friendly and made us feel welcome. We found this attitude to be the norm, everybody at the front desk and the rest of the staff were very friendly. The room was clean, and our room did have a large bathroom. TV worked good (all the better to watch the Stanley Cup before heading out). The hotel is an older building, but they have done a good job updating it. If you like a room with a lot of light, then in our experience you may not like the hotel - in our case, one small window, but I didn't book a trip to Chicago to care about light coming into the room. We simply want a clean room to sleep in, as we are out exploring during the day. Other than location (great!), some other great things about the Inn: Love the Roof Top Deck - fun view of the city, lots of space. The hotel lobby also has a screen with flights to the airports listed (chicago weather ...never know if a plane will be delayed..this screen gives up to date info on that)...and yes, GREAT coffee and treats at Lavazza right next to the hotel. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “No Television Channels???”
Reviews.Author: starbluefates
Reviews.Content: We got the Penthouse on the top floor. We got a good deal on it with an online coupon. The staff was friendly, especially the guy working the information desk to the left. He called around for about 10 minutes trying to help us find out information about a tour. That was great. I was really upset about the advertising of the 32' flat screen t.v only to get there and find out that there were no channels on it. Nothing to watch at all! I'm there for leisure I'm not going to be out and about the whole time. When I'm not I would like to relax and watch something. I don't know if this was a temporary issue or not, but we called about it and they didn't say it was. You'd think if it was a temporary problem that they would let us know if they want repeat business. If it was temporary they could have had courtesy dvd players and movies until they got it fixed. Also someone at the front desk activated our neighbors card for our room. So when their room key didn't work they walked into ours. That could have been really bad! After that my room key wouldn't work! So I took it down to get it reactivated and then my brother who was with me, his didn't work. So we went and got his reactivated. Well then mine didn't work again! So we just ended up using one key the rest of the stay. The bathroom is really small too and the shower did not seem clean to me. There was a used bar of body soap in there! Overall not a good stay, and I won't be back again! Don't advertise a 32" if it doesn't even work, that's the main reason I paid the extra for the Penthouse!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Value - Nice stay!”
Reviews.Author: Aselemia
Reviews.Content: This was my first time visiting Chicago and I had a great time! Because of the mixed reviews on this site and elsewhere, I was a bit leery upon arriving at The Inn of Chicago but thank goodness my worries were for naught. The staff was great (some friendlier than others but that's anywhere). Specifically, Bob, was immensely helpful in assisting me with navigating the city. My room was nice, clean, quiet. Everything I was looking for. A few dings in the furniture but whatever! I went to the Italian coffee place, Lavazza, adjoining the lobby for breakfast which was fine. There is also an Argo Tea across the street. I really can't find anything to complain about and I'm pretty particular. I think the charges to use the internet in their business center are a bit steep. $5.95 for 15 minutes! I think in Paris it was 1 euro for 10 minutes. Also the bottled water in the room is not free! It costs $1.50 just so you know. Overall, its a nice hotel. For the location, the price, the decor, the staff...you really can't beat it. Oh, and the shower is divine!

Reviews.Title: “Kateryna”
Reviews.Author: Kateryna777
Reviews.Content: The hotel was terrible!!!!!!!!!!!! the lobby area looked great, but i cant say the same about the room that i stayed! and as you understand i was not going to enjoy the lobby, i checked in to have some rest and enjoy the ROOM!!!!! I am in the hotel business for over 3 years already and i've never seen anything like this hotel! they dont have any parking (even parking that you need to pay for) you need to drive around downtown Chicago and find it by ourselve!!!!!!!! they do not have breakfast.......Room was clean! but maintenance needs A LOT OF improvment!! the window in our room had a hudge HOLE between ceiling and window - and it was on the 19th floor! that window could easialyfall out! and it kept our room cold all night long while we had heater on high (it was TOO noisy, but it was still TOO cold)first we could not understand why the room was still cold, but in the morning when i saw that hole - we understood why!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Got a great price but expect a small room...”
Reviews.Author: scsnative
Reviews.Content: Got a great price but expect a small room with view of two walls and the HVAC units,

Reviews.Title: “Great Location / Dirty Hotel”
Reviews.Author: thomalero
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a Great Location. It is 1 block from the Mile and a few blocks from the river and Navy Pier. I found a really great rate of $69 on Travelzoo compared to $139 on the hotels website.The hotel lobby is nice and thats where the compliments end. We arrived in Chicago around 1030 am so I called and ask for an early check in. After being hung up own twice I finally spoke to someone who said that rooms would be available around 1 but we could leave our bags. That was fine we did that and had lunch. Around 1230 we can back to the hotel to wait ti check in. After watching several people being told no you cant check in a gentleman walks in off the street books a room and is allowed to check in . This of course angers me because her we have reservation already and are made to wait.I am thinking we are sitting in front of you waiting you could have said your room is ready. I approached the counter and she gladly checked up in. The first room looked as if it hadnt been clean at all there was fecal matter in the toliet and trash in the garbage can and used soap on the sink. I called down and was given a new room and it was worse than the first. If the surrounding hotels werent 4 times as much I would have left. stopped the maid and showed her the bathroom and she told me that there were just stains on the toilet. I was stunned so I took a picture and took it to the front desk. The desk agent called the major. He was very pleasant and sent the staff up to properly clean the room and offer to have our bags transferred. Of the 3 days we were there, the maid never vaccumed the hall, she picked up big pieces of paper. She was there in the hall what seemed like all day but didnt appear to do anything. This is an older bldg. but the charms stops in the lobby. The elevators or tiny, carpet is worn and coming apart. This hotel is at best a 1 1/2 star and thats being nice. I realized the reason they offer such a deep discount. They dont have any repeat customers.The place has to potential to be a geat hotel and still a deal even at $139 if the owners would put a little into it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: venvit
Reviews.Content: Hotel situated on downtown Chicago. Very close to millennium park and all main attractions. Free wifi connection in the hall of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Great place in Central Downtown”
Reviews.Author: worldtravellers123
Reviews.Content: A good bang for location. I stayed at Inn of Chicago in July of 2009 for 5 nights. I was able to get a great deal off of Priceline.com The hotel is about one block from the main street of Michigan Ave. On Ohio st/ You are very close to the Nordstrom, Mall and 3 or 4 blocks to the Metro,train station. The hotel was very clean and easy to find. The check in process was very quick and efficent, the front desk staff were friendly and professional to their duties. Hotel gives you free WIFI in the lobby and you can also access fast internet in the rooms as well. The room was very clean and good carpet. I was on the 17th floor and had good view of the city or part of it at least. The tv was new and easy to operate. The bed was big and clean with many pillows. The bathroom was a little small but efficient. The hot water was also present on demand and you can have a hot shower anytime you wanted to. The elevators were nice and quiet, a little slow due to many people using them, overall good. Overall I would rate this hotel and recommend this to anyone who just wants a place to stay and not too picky about being anywhere fancy. You are very close to many places to eat so hotel does not need a restaurant. I would recommend hotel to singles, couples, familes or anyone or anything really. It was a good experience I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: zyphoidp
Reviews.Content: When I read the reviews on this site I was very worried about staying in this hotel. I even had some backup plans just in case it was as horrible as everyone mentioned. However that was never the case. This hotel is pretty nice and is located right in the middle of downtown. The lobby has recently been redone and is pretty nice to hang out in. Mostly everyone that is down there is using the free wifi which was decent. I stayed on the 17th floor (there are 24 in the hotel) in a room that had one queen. The room was very spacious and had a desk, and a nice reading chair with automaton. It also had a dresser and a flat screen tv (not HD). The air conditioner was nice but I will admit it seemed like I would either have the room too cold, or too hot. The bathroom itself was very nice and it was big enough for me (Im 6'6). I didn't have to turn to the side or any of that other nonsense people were talking about. The tub was very large and the showerhead was nice as well.. The bed was nice and clean and comfy as well. I stayed right next to the cleaners room and I did not get woken up by any noise they were making. However the ice machine down the hall was a little noisy but I really only noticed it while waiting for the elevator. There are three elevators in the hotel and can fit about 3-4 adults in it comfortably without luggage. They are pretty quick and also play the same music thats in the lobby. Overall my room was very nice and was a great place to stay for a few days. I think this place might have been a dump at one point, but its not the case anymore.

Reviews.Title: “Deceiving Marketing”
Reviews.Author: thevandyks
Reviews.Content: Like every one says this Hotel has the location. But it is rundown. From the moment you leave the magnificent lobby, you realize the hotel is old and run-down. The elevators are small and difficult to negotiate with a stroller or double bags. Reception was so-so, not unfriendly but did not make me feel welcome at all. You can smell the mould in the hallways, but when you enter the room it's even worse. The rooms are very small, but if you are not going to spend much time in the room it doe not matter much. The double beds are small if you are used to queen or king size. The airconditioner was so loud that we did not use it while sleeping. The bathroom is extremly small. You have to turn a little side ways when using the toilet, as the post of the wash basin is too close to the toilet. Nice washbasin, but the table on which it stood looked horrible, busy falling apart from water damage. Lots of mould on the ceiling and the toilet was leaking onto the floor. If you have any tendancy to suffer from allergies, avoid this hotel. It does not have internet service in the rooms. The business center has only one PC, which cost $5.95 for ten minutes and they charge you per copy, so to check flights and print boarding passes cost us almost $10.

Reviews.Title: “The doorman, Victor, made us feel welcome immediately.”
Reviews.Author: njs1
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded my expectations. The doorman, Victor, made us feel welcome from the moment we stepped out of our car. He was professional, friendly and extremely helpful. I noticed he was this way with everyone! He was an excellent ambassador for the hotel! The hotel's location is close to most downtown activities. In the hotel room, the bedding was very comfortable. The bathroom was tiny, and could use some updating, but it wasn't a big deal to me. It was a great value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, not what I expected...”
Reviews.Author: Newlola
Reviews.Content: My class and i got to spend the weekend at the In of Chicago. When we entered the hotel, the lobby was gorgeous, modern, elegant, and fabulous... it really impressed me... I was excited to see the room! But when we got there, it was another story... Sure our room was big, but the smell was more noticeable. In the tiny bathroom, we discovered mold growing up and around the toilet, in the main room, it was poorly configured, had mold on the carpet, a cracked window, and many other flaws. Besides all of the negatives, the hotel had an amazing location, closest to all of the "hotspots" with a breathtaking view from the terrace.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, not-so-great rooms”
Reviews.Author: ATFLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Chicago Inn for a conference and in short, the stay was okay. It's located in the heart of downtown Chicago which is awesome. It was close to many restaurants and sights to see. That definitely was the high-light of the hotel experience. As for the rooms, they were clean but small. You're not able to open the windows at all so it unfortunately smelled like dirty laundry. I got a very good deal on the room through hotels.com but the room was just reeked. They charge $41 for parking a day (valet; you can go and come as you please) and you also had to pay for wi-fi. Wi-fi is free if you're in the lobby, but who wants to shack up next to someone at 11pm when you just need to check your email? I would have rather they put that cost into the rooms instead of having to pay $10 per 24 hrs block of wi-fi. This may not be a problem for you but it is something I wish someone would have told me. There are other great hotels near by so check into this if it of interest to you at all. Otherwise, the hotel was stay was average. Customer service was also lacking as well. Front desk was not very welcoming and had a demeanor of shuffling people in and out with little to no personalization of who and what "Chicago Inn at the Magnificent Mile" is all about. Oh, and the hotel itself is gorgeous in terms of decor; very modern in theme but customer service is definitely lacking.

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: steph2003x
Reviews.Content: We love Chicago and visit there at least once a year. I booked this hotel through a deal on travelzoo, so it was well worth what I paid. We only stayed one night, and were very happy. Check-out was at noon, but they kept our bags as long as we needed them to, while we walked around the city. We were on the 10th floor, and going downstairs to the nice lobby to use the free wi-fi was no problem. The lobby was nice and comfy. The staff was very helpful, when I called them to find out how to get there from Midway airport. They told me the airport shuttle was $19 per person, and a taxi would be about $30. I asked about the train and they told me the nearest station was only 2 blocks away. Everything is within walking distance, and the room was comfortable, though the bathroom was small. It was exactly what I expected in a boutique style hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but watch your money”
Reviews.Author: kelzerUK
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, good location - but they took my money twice and will not respond to emails. Travelling across US and this is the only hotel I have had a problem with. Their refusal to even acknowledge my emails makes me think twice about going there again. Just watch it at check-in, we had a pre-paid voucher but said they just wanted to authorize a card - but they took the money and won't reply to me. If their customer service was better this would be one of the best places we stayed.

Reviews.Title: “A good, solid choice for location and value”
Reviews.Author: SnoopnMak
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel was great, very convenient to the attractions of Chicago as well as public transportation. The lobby was comfortable and staff members were very friendly. The room, in particular the bathroom, was small but adequate. It was clean and comfortable. The bed was pretty sunken in the middle and, unfortunately, the second "bed" in the suite was actually a futon (this was not clear in the description of the room). All in all, we felt the accomodations were more than fair for the price we paid. With the money you save staying here rather than a 5-star hotel, go to dinner at Quartino nearby. It's excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: ChrissyUSA
Reviews.Content: I loved this Hotel. It was about 2 Blocks from the Metro. The Rooms where comfortable and clean. The had the best smelling Soap and Shampoo I've ever had in a Hotel. You could walk everywhere it was so close to all the Sightseeing Stuff. Navy Pier is about 5 or 6 Blocks. Milenium Park, we didnt walk longer then maybe 20min. I just loved it. The Concierge was extremely helpfull and the Lobby is just a pure Eyecatcher. Modern and Comfortable with a big Fireplace to sit. The one point that sucked was that the Free Wifi didn't seem to work in the Rooms so you had to take your Laptop to the Lobby to use it, but its not that big of a Deal. Its free after all and not $9.99 for 24 hours. I would recommend this Hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Beds too soft..otherwise great bargain”
Reviews.Author: ewkIowa
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Inn of Chicago over 2 dozen times in the last 15 years...it's quiet, well situated, well priced. Always worked for me until this visit. We immediately sank into the beds, and not in a good way. They were waaay too soft. I called the front desk and was told all the beds were new within the last 2 years, and they were all like this. They didn't look old, so they must have been designed this way. We did not sleep well, and my back didn't do well afterwards. It's a shame because this was our hotel to go to in Chicago, and until this bed situation is improved we'll have to go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “pretty good hotel at the heart of Chicago”
Reviews.Author: dannyUsa
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at this hotel for two days in summer and we were really surprised about the great service and the comfortable room we got. The Inn is very easy to find and it's located just 2 streets from Michigan Ave. The room are quite large and the beds are cozy. They had just put a new carpet into the room when we stayed there and therefore it we could still smell the glue. But thanks to the a/c, the smell wasn't as bad anymore. The bad was ok, clean and also quite large. If you want to stay at a not too price hotel in the great city of Chicago, this is the perfect place to stay at!

Reviews.Title: “Great service and location!”
Reviews.Author: burningrivergirl
Reviews.Content: I want to start by letting you know that this hotel is inside a very old building. I am guessing that the building used to be an old hotel and that is now remodeled and updated as the Inn of Chicago. With this in mind, the bathrooms are small, but clean and functional. The hotel is in a great location! Walking distance to the L stop, the Magnificent Mile shopping, tons of restaurants such as Giordano's Chicago pizza, Navy Pier, Hancock building etc The staff was also always very friendly and helpful. We needed an early check in and they provided that to us with no questions asked. On our last day we discovered that our flight hom was cancelled and the front desk staff extended our check-out by two hours while we considered our options. We ended up staying an extra night and they provided us with a great rate that was less than what we had paid the other two nights. Room was cleaned everyday with no problems and everone was friendly. We used the free internet access in the lobby with our laptop several times. Also the bell hop at the door was very helpful and kind to us. He gave us advice on attractions to visit and places to eat. We had to leave our hotel for the airport on our way out of Chicago at 5am and he arranged the say before for a cabbie to pick us up. So helpful! Thank you Inn of Chicago for a great stay in the Windy City!

Reviews.Title: “Impressive hotel amongst over-priced low-quality others”
Reviews.Author: nebgreg
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Inn of Chicago for 5 nights over New Years, 2009. I think the previous reviews for this property are right on. The good: The location is absolutely wonderful. Literally a few steps from Michigan Ave and a pleasant walk to the Hancock Tower and Water Tower Place Mall. El Train stop was a bit farther than I had thought, but it wasn't a terrible walk even in January. The room was clean and well-maintained. The housekeeping staff was incredible--friendly, helpful, always asked if we needed extra of anything and just plain wonderful. Bathroom was a bit small, but it wasn't an inconvenience (unless, of course, you are used to a few hundred square foot master bath). Nice flat screen TV, comfortable bed and lots of hanger space. We stayed in a king room on the 10th floor which was away from the street traffic noise and relatively quiet. The bad: Check-in time was 3pm and there was absolutely no budging on this. We arrived at 1:45pm and had to sit in the lobby and wait until 3pm. It was about 5 degrees outside, snowing and just plain miserable. I couldn't believe we weren't allowed in the room an hour early. I had requested (prior to arrival) to have a floor on the upper-levels away from the street. For the desk staff person, this seemed to be the special request of the century. She seemed annoyed and frustrated with my request. I actually felt a bit guilty for even asking for it. When we arrived in the room, it was clean except for a hunk of some type of chocolate (I hope) on the bedspread. We tossed the bedspread aside and didn't use it. On New Year's Eve, all hotel guests were required to have a wristband to gain access to the property. I understand and appreciate the security, but we were given bright pink, paper wristbands most often used by those college-aged bars. It was New Year's and we were dressed in suits, going to a nice dinner and here we were with bright pink paper wristbands like we had been at a spring break frat party. Good idea, but better execution please! The hotel gym was moved to the 3rd level, but the book in the room still said 15th floor. Overall, we had a good stay. Sure, there were a few annoyances, but the location, the price (we paid approximately $79 per night) and the quality were good. I would recommend this hotel to others who want to stay near Michigan Ave and not pay the ridiculous prices of most hotels in that area.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with a comfortable bed”
Reviews.Author: Yen_8
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights over the new year period. Booked through expedia so the rate was a steal so I didn't have high expectations for the room. I was pleasantly suprised. The Queen room on the 14th floor was small, but big enough for two. It was clean, had a nice TV and a very comfy bed. The bathroom was very small but the shower was powerful and hot, the toilet and sink clean, shelving was available for my toiletries and hooks on the back of the door to hang things up. Housekeeping did their job everyday without any trouble. The front desk staff were very helpful and provided me with maps, bus routes and restaurant info. The bell staff also helped with all the options I could use to get back to the airport. Location was great, only a short walk to the bus stop and the trains, navy pier and the shopping. If anything, the table the bathroom sink rests on could do with being replaced, and the complimentary coffee could be better. If I had paid full price, I would have expected this and maybe more. But I didn't and can honestly say it was a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, bad service...”
Reviews.Author: AJulie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I found this hotel at Expedia for a good price and, after checking the reviews on T.A., decided to stay there for two days. Located in a excellent spot, we thought the staff at the reception were nice and the lobby was ok, cozy, but not fancy. The room was really small. The bathroom was the tiniest hotel bathroom I've ever seem! The pictures we saw at the website did not have much to do with the real thing, the room needed some repairs and the covers from our bad were stained (I even saw a blood spot the following day, disgusting!). Besides the disappointment, we decided to stay and the following day we were out all day sightseeing and shopping. We got back to the hotel around 6 p.m. and they had not serviced our room. We called the manager to complain and according to them, they did not clean up our room because they were understaffed. They would be willing to send us some clean sheets and towels though...come on! They were nice enough to give us some complimentary drinks at the bar (very nice bartender, by the way...), but it did not easy my disappointment of staying in a hotel that tell their guests to make their own bed...

Reviews.Title: “Basic & a bit shabby - but for the rate and location, could not be beat!”
Reviews.Author: cdame
Reviews.Content: I'll begin with my booking process. I booked through expedia and a few days later I called to verify my reservation as I always do when I travel. Of three phone calls, two of the representatives told me my room had NOT been paid for when in fact, I had already paid through Expedia and the charge was on my credit card. Another time, I was transferred to the front desk and they told me my room was paid for. I told them I didn't want to have any issues when I check in. I used the customer service address on their website and sent the hotel an e-mail asking about refrigerators and credit card authorization form (I let my husband have the credit card that weekend) and I never got a response after a few days, so I called the front desk and they faxed a credit card authorization form, I faxed it back with a note asking to please call me when they receive it. Never received a call back, so I took a hard copy of the form to Chicago with me. When I arrived, they did have my form with the instructions to call me on the form, but I guess that wasn't very important! Where do the email messages go? And why didn't someone call me? The lobby of the hotel is lovely - the elevators are small but decent and fairly quick. The room was OK - I was actually expecting the worst since the rate was so low, but the room was very basic, with beds above normal quality. Furniture, TV, etc were basic. Room was on the small side, but definitely not a problem and comfortable for two people. We were lucky to have a corner room at the very end of the 14th floor. We had two windows and one faced busy Michigan Aveue and the other faced high-rise condos next door and was directly above one of my favorite Chicago restaurants - Sayat Nova Armenian Cuisine! Three things really irked me about the stay: a) The bathroom was small but that's fine...but I don't remember the last time I was in a hotel bathroom that didn't have a fan for ventilation. Just a basic light. So no fan to help with steam during showers and to help cover sounds and smells (hey, we were eating all kinds of great food on our trip). Plus, we could hear very clearly the people who were either in the bathroom across the hall or above us through the vent. We could hear their TV and we could hear the girls chit-chatting as they got dressed for the night. Very clearly! So they could probably hear us take showers or pee! And then b) The hallway on the 14th floor - I don't think it was vacuumed once during our 3 nights there. The same threads and bits of paper were on the ratty carpet the whole time we were there. The ratty carpet made me fear the worst as we approached our room, but the room wasn't ratty like the hallway was, fortunately! It was obvious that we were put on a crappier floor because we visited the 22nd floor terrace and you could tell those rooms were nicer - the carpet was new and vacuumed on that floor, and the doors themselves were renovated and shiny with a wood-stain finish. But again, I don't mind because we had such a great rate in such a great location. c) Every time I went to the desk from check in, to requesting directions to asking for a late check-out, there wasn't anyone there, and I had to cough or knock on the desk or make some sort of sound so that the person in the back room would notice I was there. I presume there must be a camera so the attendants can monitor the desk, but if not, someone should be posted to be there so people don't have to wait. Keep in mind the hotel has no frills - no room service or food available at night. There is a business center (computer kiosk) that charges about $5 per 15 minutes of internet access. There is a workout room. An independently managed bar off of the lobby but they don't have food. There is also a Lavazza cafe located off the lobby but after they close, no food options. But that's okay because you're in downtown CHICAGO and there is food and shopping everywhere. Despite my little issues, I'd definitely stay here again. The rate I booked on expedia was about 50% off the rate they promoted on their website and it was an absolute steal. Would I pay full price for these rooms, no. But I will definitely look on Expedia for this specific hotel next time I go to Chicago, which will probably be within the next month. This hotel is half a block off of Michigan Avenue, next to Eddie Bauer, the Gap, Guess?, Forever21 and a movie theatre. Within walking to all Michigan Avenue shops, different churches, and you can walk to Navy Pier, etc. An amazing steal for those who are budget-conscious and don't need anything fancy. I even walked the approx 20 blocks to Union Station and it was fine.

Reviews.Title: “BASIC- no frills but good location”
Reviews.Author: youngConnoisseur
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because we got a REALLY good price and it is centrally located. For the price and location it cannot be beat, but do not expect much. The bed was very uncomfortable, the room was really small and the TV was old and oddly placed. The bathroom was very small and there was no counter space. We slept horrible. I hate it when hotels use two flat sheets instead of a fitted sheet and a flat sheet. I also HATE it when the "mattress pad" is a single piece of thicker cotton that is not attached to the bed in any way. They bunch up and move around and are just so uncomfortable. Also, was not quiet in our room. I don't know if it was the elevator or something in the walls, but I kept hearing odd noises- buzzing, ringing and such. If you are a heavy sleeper and will not be staying long you can give it a try, but you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel- Do not stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: vangier
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel because of some good reviews. When we checked in and got into our room the bathroom was a mess. The toilet as used, the stuff was all over the lid of the toilet and it was not flush at all. I almost got sick. I called the front desk and ask someone to clean it up.Some one did clean it up. I also asked for the supervisor and no one show's up. The supervisor or manager did not even call me. My husband and I were so tired from the flight, or we would have leaved the place. I definitely would not recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Thats about all!!!”
Reviews.Author: markhay
Reviews.Content: stayed at the Inn of Chicago for 8 nights,very well situated,rooms are comfortable but could do with water and t bags as there is no breakfast room or restaurant at this hotel. Travelled all the way from Scotland to be given a room on the 4th floor looking over the marriot hotels brick wall at the back a view wouldve been nice. Arrived at reception to be greeted by staff who at the time couldnt be more awkward or rude if they tried to a fellow guest who was obviously in distress all because they couldnt get her card to swipe treateed like she was a criminal and not a guest,thought to myself i certainly wouldnt put up with that treatment,however when my daughters swipe card for her room wouldnt work the young spikey haired lad at reception who also looked after?? the guest in was referring to then tried to do exactly the same with myself and managed to press all of my buttons to the point he was a very lucky his manager stepped in. not the way you want to be spoken to whilst having a vacation. T he Bar!! If you like to wind down at night with family or friends you certainly cant do it here as the bar opens approx 5pm and closes at whatever time the barperson decides and on the night we were meeting our friends who had travelled from kentucky happened to be 10pm?? and not only on this occasion ,however Dan was a very nice person but as he admitted was part of a union so dont expect to be served within 15-20minutes or more if he has someone else hed prefer to chat to. Waited 21years to take my son to Chicago as hes always been a massive Bulls fan only to be Dissapointed in this historic hotel. The hotel however is perfectly located and the porters are definately the nicest and most helpfull of the staff and nothings to much for them and thankgoodness someone seems to care about customer service. I dont usually rant on unless im mistreated and i do know what customer service is as i do own a hote,a guesthouse and a publib bar in dif towns in Scotland and none of these staff except for the porters and the black lady behind reception would be employed by us even if it meant we had to work 24hours a day till someone else came alon. Theres plenty more hotels in Chicago and whilst this one is central i would give it a miss this time around Our kids are 21 and 19 and our friends are early 40s as well as ourselves and we all agree and all had plenty of fun elsewhere. So sad for such a great hotel with history that no one seems to care. Long live the unions???? (Not)

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: karen22428
Reviews.Content: This was my first time in Chicago and my friend and I were a little uncertain about this hotel before we got there. It was amazing. The staff (especially LaTonya and Dan the bartender) could not have been more helpful. Everything was taken care of for us, and the location is perfect. The value of this hotel far exceeds the others I checked out. We were so sad to leave!

Reviews.Title: “Far and Away the Best Customer Service EVER!!!!”
Reviews.Author: erourke
Reviews.Content: My family and I decided to meet in Chicago for a weekend together. My future brother-in-law had decided to propose to my sister at the hotel on their terrace. The concierge LaTonya and manager Alyn did EVERYTHING in their power (including staying past their work hours) to help us make this the most amazing proposal ever. I have NEVER experienced such help and kindness from a hotel staff in my life. Words can't even begin to express the wonderful things they did for us. In addition, they helped with dinner reservations, special touches, tours, etc. Staff is hands down the best out there. The rooms are simple, clean and just enough room to be comfortable. The hotel just had such a cozy, family feel to it that I don't ever plan on staying anywhere else in Chicago. You won't be disappointed. Not to mention, the rates are absolutely unbeatable!!! I would recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Location but disappointing.”
Reviews.Author: fallbird
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed on business trip. Lobby has been renovated to appear as a boutique hotel, but this isn't true for the rooms. Faded but clean room. Small bathrooms with no counter and shoddy worksmanship. We had to change rooms because of the odor of the carpet cleaning solution used in the hallway. Free wi-fi in lobby was a plus. Front staff were very helpful and friendly, but overall it was disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “I'd definately stay again!”
Reviews.Author: ToledoRick
Reviews.Content: I hadn't stayed at the Inn of Chicago for years, and after reading some of the negative comments was a little reluctant. Glad I booked it. The front desk was extremely friendly. Surprisingly, the manager came out to greet me, welcomed me to the hotel, and told me not to hesitate to contact him if he could do anything to make my stay more enjoyable. Room was roomy and clean. The only negative was that the mattress was so soft we kept feeling like we were rolling to the center of the bed. The hotel is a great location and well maintained. We'll definately stay here next time we visit Chicago and would not hesitate to recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “What was all the complaining about....?”
Reviews.Author: quickblip
Reviews.Content: Wow - the folks out there had me so scared about this hotel that I tried to change hotels an hour before my plane left for my business trip to Chicago. What was all the huffing and puffing about? Hands down, this hotel is in an amazing location. Staff was friendly an accomodating. I asked for a room upgrade and got the Junior Suite - a cute little "apartment" with a living room area, plasma tv, a wet bar, bathroom, and bedroom (bed was SUPER COZY). The room was clean, and any request for additional toiletries was granted with a smile. The only reason I would say that the room was a 4 was due to the lack of complimentary internet in the room. The lobby has access to free Wi-Fi and is a cozy little hang out spot (I'm actually in the lobby area writing this review while I wait for my shuttle to the airport). So - don't listen to the negative reviews. You're in a great location, fun hangout spots are at abundance, and they are quick to accomodate for upgrade requests.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Prices...”
Reviews.Author: ebola_1
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here for 3 nights. The location is great, very close to the Loop. We stayed in a standard room but it was like compressed, the bath too. There was a door to another room I guess, luckily it was locked. The air conditioner was a little bit noisy and very old. If you are not looking for luxury but a budget place close to the Loop, I recommend the Inn of Chicago, Magnificent Mile.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location”
Reviews.Author: Furaka
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 6 nights. Very pleased with location and quality, although we did book on a discount site and paid about 40% below original hotel price, which is probably why we thought it was such a good deal. Coffee shop downstairs with great cappucinos, excellent service at front desk, one block away from Mag Mile. Walking distance to underground, and to Navy Pier. Beautiful rooftop patio, and despite the signs, hotel staff don't mind if you buy a bevvie at the 7-eleven across the street and bring upstairs to the patio. Rooms are quite small, as are bathrooms, but clean. Cleaning staff are a bit loud in the morning, and have a tendency to ignore the "do not disturb" on the door and walk right in - be sure to use the chain lock!! Elevators are tiny and you may have to wait a few minutes to get up to your floor, but really not an issue.

Reviews.Title: “Don't get too picky!”
Reviews.Author: JSL47
Reviews.Content: I've read all the negatives - and there is an element of truth to them. On the whole, however, I thought this was a good place to stay. We previously stayed here before the renovations: the place is much better now. The staff were friendly enough: I don't expect gush. Sean behind the desk deserves a special mention: he dealt with a minor reservation glitch by giving us a better discount than I ever expected, and upgrading us to a corner room with a bigger bed. Yes, the bathroom was tiny, though it wouldn't actually cause any problems to a normal-sized person. Did the roof terrace close at night? Yes, but only when you'd had chance to watch the sun set, and it was pitch black. There were signs telling you not to bring in drink from outside, but in view of the hotel bar prices, none of the guests seemed to take any notice! Was the bar expensive? Yes, hotel bars always are. Was it full of oldies, too scared to venture out? Well I probably was one of those oldies, collapsing into the bar for a last nightcap with my wife and our friends after "hitting the town" from morning till night! If you want to be picky, pay a lot more money and stay in a better hotel: then get picky! This is probably the cheapest hotel on Michigan Avenue.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Reasonable Price, Mediocre Service”
Reviews.Author: mmoore181
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights in mid-September. The price was fair (about $100/night) and the location was great. Easy walking distance to the Navy Pier, River North, Streeterville, etc. and it was practically on the Magnificent Mile. Close to the subway at State Street. Amenities were ok. Nice workout room with good and ample equipment. Nice top-floor terrace with a good view (although the hours weren't great -- it closed at 10pm). One big drawback was no free WiFi in the rooms -- you had to go down to the lobby, which was usually filled with other guests doing the same thing. Particularly bothersome was that you could not get WiFi reception in the hotel bar, which was just a few feet away from the lobby. The room was clean and the maid service was good. The TV was an old CRT and the picture was a little fuzzy. The room is on the smaller side, and the bathroom is really tiny. We could've used 4 pillows instead of 3, and plush instead of feathered. Other than that, the room was fine. The bar was kind of lame. The only patrons were middle-aged to senior-aged guests of the hotel who seemed to frightened to venture outside. The beer selection was terrible (who needs 12 domestic lagers?) and overpriced. We didn't try any "signature cocktails," and I'm sure we weren't missing much. The bartender was a bit of a jerk, too. We hoped to see a different bartender later in our stay, but it was the same guy every night. The bell desk was cool about keeping our bags for us while we did some more sightseeing on our last day after we checked out. The bell staff was very helpful and friendly, beyond their duties. The front desk staff wasn't terrible, but seemed aloof and nonplussed about working there. On the first night, our keycards were somehow erased and we had to go to front desk to have them replaced. The staff didn't seem to concerned or apologetic about this inconvenience to us. As for food, there was a nice tea/coffee shop across the street, a 24 hour Dunkin' Donuts (!!!), and a burrito place that was not that great. Also, a gay bar called "Second Story Bar" which we almost tried out before reading that it was a gay bar (we're a straight couple -- nothing against gay bars, just not our scene). At night, there was a creepy, lurking security guard who gave everyone who was sitting in the lobby silent, dirty looks. A little odd. Other reviewers complained about the noise and proximity to a fire station. We were on the 14th floor and didn't have any complaints about that. The walls are thin, however, and we had some rowdy frat boy neighbors the last night we stayed there. Overall, for the price and location, this hotel was worth it. If you're looking for better amenities (e.g., breakfast, free WiFi), then you might want to stay somewhere pricier. But this was a decent hotel and we were basically happy with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Right off the Magnificent Mile”
Reviews.Author: letsgohere
Reviews.Content: Three friends and I stayed in a double-double room at this hotel for one night. You can't beat the price for this location. The rooms are small, but the space is used well, so I didn't feel like we were tripping over each other. Two complaints would be that the air conditioner was a bit noisy, and don't even think about spending time in the room watching TV as the picture-quality was terrible and there was a humming noise coming from it. On the positive side, the 22nd floor terrace has really nice views. Parking was very expensive, but I guess that's to be expected if you stay downtown. We did self-park instead of valet and paid $60 for parking from 9:30 a.m. to 11:30 the next morning. When going out at night, we had no trouble getting a taxi, as there were plenty waiting right out front.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we thought it would be...”
Reviews.Author: BW1981KansasCity
Reviews.Content: Check in: Our room was not ready till 4:30 (check in at 3 and they kick you out by 12 noon) not sure why it takes 4.5 hrs to clean such a small room! The front desk clerk was so rude!! The room was small, dark, dirty looking. The Bed was not comfortable, a sheet as the main cover of the bed...?? The bathroom was so small, hit your knees on the sink if you are sitting on the toilet. Waiting in line for an elevator everytime you try to up or down. Having the maids storage next to our room was not great-- they are so loud banging stuff around in there. was up every morning by 6:45 b/c of that! For the price we paid I should have spent an extra $100.to stay at a nice hotel down the street. The door guys at other places where nicer than this place. Not one person the entire 4 days said one word to us. I would never stay here again if it was free!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not as pictured”
Reviews.Author: Hgolitely
Reviews.Content: We selected the Inn of Chicago based on the web site, it looked contemporary and convenient. The Hotel lobby looked like one of those $1000.00 makeover shows. Very cheaply done. There was an odd smell in the entire hotel and they tried to mask it with Flower freshener which made it worse. The furniture in the lobby and halls were covered with lint and stains. The rooms were small (which is fine) but they were FILTHY. We went straight to the lobby to get out $ back and move on. After a battle with the manager he finally stated he would let us out of our reservation. Which left us on the street in January with our luggage. Horrible experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Horrible Rooms”
Reviews.Author: giosciohl
Reviews.Content: We stayed her because I got a good rate with Hotwire Travel Ticker and we were on a budget for our hotel room. We also picked it because it is so close to Michigan Ave. which was great, but our stay was anything but. Our room looked nothing like the rooms they display on their website. It looked like the decor hadn't been touched or changed in years. The bathrooms were so small that only one person could be in there at a time and if you really wanted to, you could go to the bathroom and wash your hands at the same time. The beds were very uncomfortable and the duvet cover was only enclosed by two flat sheets, which was disgusting because I doubt they wash the duvet covers very often. After a long day of shopping and running around, we were ready to get back to our room and shower. The hotel only has 3 small elevators for 22 floors that fit four people comfortably and 6 people tight. We had to wait in line and for numerous elevators to come through before we could even get on one. That drove me crazy since all I wanted to do was sit back and relax, not wait in line for an elevator. It wasn't enjoyable relaxing in the room because the room was much smaller than an average room you would find at Hampton Inn or a Holiday Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Great location downtown by Michigan Avennue”
Reviews.Author: Lotta_Lennartsson
Reviews.Content: Very central location off Michigan Avenue, near shopping and restaurants and 5 min to nearest train station.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location, comfortable bed”
Reviews.Author: luciya
Reviews.Content: I was sent to a conference in Chicago downtown. This hotel is just 1 block away. I am satisfied about the location. I was a little disappointed when I stepped in the room. The room is kinda small and the dark blue patten carpet didn't look clean. However, the bed is very comfortable. After staying there for three nights, I didnt feel the room was that small any more and I found they use space very efficiently - the tiny bathroom has everything. But I still feel that they need to clean the carpet, and it would be much more convenient if they have free internet in each room, so people wont have to go to the lobby and check their emails.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: kelz711
Reviews.Content: Didn't cost that much, I had gotten a discount. Was right in the heart of downtown. A lot of other people complained of small rooms, but I had gotten a pretty big one. Friendly staff. Its not the Ritz Carlton but It was safe clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Says it's 3 stars - not even close !”
Reviews.Author: massimoo1
Reviews.Content: Fair at best. Stayed here on a last minute "deal" - advertized as 3 star hotel. It's a stretch to call it a 2 star ! Good location but otherwise, nothing but disappointments. Poor service, only fairly clean (below average), small rooms and bathrooms, not very attentive service. Wouldn't stay there again unless the price is ROCK bottom !

Reviews.Title: “NPE 2009”
Reviews.Author: by_bio
Reviews.Content: It's ok for business trips. Few steps from Michigan Avenue. Clean. Good wi-fi connection. Good bar service. No breakfast service, but a nice Lavazza shop next the side entrance.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: nctravel40
Reviews.Content: I must say location location location. This hotel has one of the best locations. We were able to walk, get the bus or jump on the city tour bus and get around the city without a hitch. This is not the Ritz Carlton so if that is what you are looking for donâ€™t book this hotel. Yes, the bathrooms are very small but we donâ€™t base our stay or enjoyment on the size of the bathroom It was very clean, updated and great water temperature. We found the bed very comfortable. We paid less than 70 dollars a night through easyclicktravel.com so we felt it was a bargain. It afforded us the ability to get two rooms one for my husband and I and one for our teenagers. The lobby and bar were also great. I have no complaints. Yes I would recommend this hotel for a friend and we will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Inn of Chicago - perfect”
Reviews.Author: kathscro
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights and were given a corner room. We had a great time. The room was a good size and while the bathroom was small, it was not a problem for us. The Inn is within walking distance of so many attractions - it's the perfect location. Usually, when renting a room, there is always something wrong. Maybe the coffee maker doesn't work. Maybe the bed is uncomfortable. Maybe no one answers when you call the front desk. Maybe you can't get the water in the shower to the right temp. There was absolutely nothing wrong with this hotel. It even smelled good. We will not only stay again, we would recommend it to anyone going for sight-seeing. Lovely place.

Reviews.Title: “small rooms & bathrooms”
Reviews.Author: JohnOOmaha
Reviews.Content: ridiculuosly small old bathrooms slow hot elevators hot hallways security people bothering you while your having cocktails and just laughing ??????????

Reviews.Title: “Hire a new staff!”
Reviews.Author: CKCinci
Reviews.Content: My brothers and I traveled to Chicago for the Cubs/Reds game this past weekend, and unfortunately we stayed at the historic Inn of Chicago. We were able to overlook the small rooms, closet-sized bathrooms and elevators, lack of room safes, etc. Not a huge deal. As is often the case, though, PEOPLE are the true indicators of a good business, and this establishment gets two thumbs down. Day 1: Following our arrival Friday afternoon,. I realized I had left my camera in the car. Since the car was valet parked (for $41/day), I kindly requested an employee retrieve my camera for me. This slight request was answered with a furrowed brow and huffy response from the door man. Frankly, I was taken aback with such a response. This guy works here, right? Only after I repeated the request, did the man get on his walkie-talkie with the valet. The camera was then delivered to me, 20 minutes later. I was slightly irritated, but let it go...... Day 2: After an exhausting day on the town, my brothers and I made our way to the hotel terrace for a cigarette and to enjoy the night air. It was midnight, and we soon learned that the terrace closes at 10:00 pm -- for some people.. Although a group of ladies and an older man were out there having a wonderful time, when WE sat down at a table and chairs, security appeared. The security guard walked right past the other patrons, and told us the terrace was closed. Again, I was shocked and irritated. I realize that my brothers are large men, and for people who do not know them, they may appear threatening. In reality, however, they are respectful and respectable men and do not deserve to be discriminated against. I was angry, but again I let it go...... Day 3: I was ready to go. Unfortunately, when my vehicle was pulled around by the valet, I immediately noticed that the clock face was damaged. I pointed the damage out to the valet who basically ignored me, then told me to talk to the man working at the garage across the street. He was obviously no help either. I filed a vandalism claim with my insurance and am out $150. Would I return to this hotel? No. Would I fire the staff and rehire new? Absolutely.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Mexican-Pete
Reviews.Content: Within walking distance of all main attractions. Try Mary's Cafe for breakfast not West Egg that the hotel staff recommend. Staff were extremely helpful with all enquiries. Only small criticism would be the size of the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “amazing hotel and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: sama0428
Reviews.Content: ok yes i agree with everyone the bathroom was extremely small but other than that i thought everything was wonderful i love the patio on the 22nd floor because everyone could go there you could bring mcdonalds up there if you wanted it wasn't a pricey restruant that only a few could afford so everyone got to enjoy the beautiful view

Reviews.Title: “Shockingly Negative Experience”
Reviews.Author: MissyAnn4726
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed in the Inn of Chicago as a return visitor. The customer service has not been a pleasant situation due to a financial situation that has occurred. Prior to check out I went to the front desk and requested to pay $100 cash towards the room prior to check out with my boyfriend. I mainly wanted to pay for the valet of my car however decided that the even dollar amount would be good. I handed over the cash and the cashier looked at me as if I was wasting her time; at that time I required a receipt be provided; I must admit it was my fault for not reviewing the folded up receipt because the cashier charged the credit card that reserved the room. Once the credit card statement was received there were two charges; one in the amount of $100 and the other for the remaining amount. Very odd how the one receipt that was for $100 cash does not have a cashier number listed... The accounting staff has not been pleasant and is not willing to connect us directly with the hotel manager, office manager, front desk manager, etc (we keep getting the run around) and keeps insisting that we will receive a call back. I do however find it odd that the accountant has reviewed the video tape and apparently stated that I paid with a credit card which was never swiped and what in the world would the cashier do with the credit card since she didn't hand anything back to me. I feel that they are not taking the proper steps to resolve this issue. We will not be staying here again, if you can't trust the lobby/cashier staff on camera who can you trust. We stayed at the Inn of Chicago to save money with a discount as a returning customer however in the long run paid more.

Reviews.Title: “All talk, no action.”
Reviews.Author: Mccoyote
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed by this hotel. In the pictures it looked cute and trendy looking but when we got there we found that all of that trendiness was all for show and that there is no comfort. The room was small : the lamps made a weird noise, the A/C made a really loud noise and half the channels on the TV were blurry. The bathroom was TINY and the closet minuscule. As for the location, it was ok but I will not stay in Magnificent Mile next time I'm in Chicago - too many tourists with white sneakers, it reminded me of Times Square! Just annoyingly touristy. The price was right for the location and "look" of this hotel but it's basically all it's got going for it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, big room, excellent value”
Reviews.Author: kickice
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel online and got an amazing deal despite it being over July 4th weekend. Because of that I was expecting to turn up and get some tiny box room, so I was very pleasantly surprised to get a really big room - most impressive! It was well furbished, comfortable bed, nicely decorated. No complaints at all. The location of the hotel is as good as it gets, half a block from the southern end of Mag Mile. Means you can walk anywhere central in the loop, Grant Park, Millennium Park, Mag Mile, River North, Streeterville, Gold Cost neighborhoods as well as Navy Pier. And public transport is close for the rest, busses on N. Michigan, and the red line El just a few blocks way. The hotel itself is a pretty cool older building, the lobby is nice (there is a very modern minimalist looking bar there too, but I didn't go in. Also a coffee place attached). Yep, the lifts can be a bit slow, being an older building, they are smaller. But it wasn't that bad really, didn't have to wait to long ever. I guess people can be impatient on vacation! There is also a roof terrace with a good view. Wireless internet is available for free in the lobby, but not in rooms. Any downsides? The only thing I can say I thought a bit shoddy was the room servicing. Just things like towels not being replaced one day, 2 or 3 days when the coffee pot was left uncleaned and coffee sachets not replaced, bathroom floor not swept. Nothing major, but just a bit slack.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient”
Reviews.Author: ilwag
Reviews.Content: The hotel is right in the middle of things so makes an excellent place to stay. We walked to Grant Park, Navy Pier, North Michigan avenue shops, and the Gold coast. The hotel is old but clean and nice. Check-in was fast and the man couldn't have been friendlier. All staff was extremely pleasant and friendly. It was an excellent buy because we got the rooms at lower than any other on or near Michigan Avenue. The best part of the hotel is the Terrace on the 22nd floor. It overlooks the city and is a wonderful place to sit and visit with friends, read newspapers, see city lights after dark, whatever. Coffee shops are attached and two are right across the street. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: economista9
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Inn of Chicago during the weekend of June 26, 2009. I booked the room the same day for $91 at Hotwire, and it was a fine deal. The hotel is centrally located one block west of the Magnificent Mile, but it's not noisy at all. I arrived around 12:30am and quickly checked into my room, which was very small but clean and comfortable, with an excellent shower and nicely appointed bathroom. The day that I checked out, I received a mistaken wake-up call at 7am, but I called the front desk and asked if I could check out a little later to catch up on the interrupted sleep, and I was able to stay until 2pm. All in all, I enjoyed staying in this hotel and I would stay again with my husband... but not with anyone else; too little space!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location, horrible customer service”
Reviews.Author: kcmorg
Reviews.Content: My wife and two young boys stayed at this hotel for 4 days and 3 nights in June of 2009. As many others have stated, the location of this hotel cannot be beat. Walking distance to the Magnificent Mile (if you like shopping), to the Navy Pier, and many other attractions. Just a short train ride will get you to Wrigley Field for a Cubs game. I take one or two business trips a year, and usually stay at the Marriot or Hilton. This hotel is not up to their standards, but it is not bad. The elevators are the smallest I have seen anywhere, but that isn't really that big of a deal. The rooms were good size, except for the bathroom. Don't even think of trying to get more than one person ready at a time in these bathrooms. They are extremely small in space and size!! Also, the outside noises are not kept out very well at all. I was woken up many times due to noises going on outside. As with most places I visit these days, the customer service had much room for improvement. Have you ever gone somewhere that is supposed to serve you, and when you ask them questions or ask them for help you feel like you are bothering them or taking up their precious time? Well, that's how we felt more than once here. I asked a lady at the front desk if it would be possible for me to print something off that I needed to print. She tried to answer my question while she was busy walking bath and forth trying to do some of her own work. She then finally told me that yes, they could help me print something, but their printer doesn't work most of the time. She then told me to I should go to another business to print something for $5.00. She was just rude and very unhelpful. Would I recommend someone to stay at this hotel. Well, yes and no. Don't even think about paying regular rates for this hotel. Find a deal on hotels.com, hotwire, or somewhere else. Once you get the price down to half of what you pay for a top-of-the-line hotel, then stay.

Reviews.Title: “WARNING: OUR SOUVENIRS WERE STOLEN OUT OF OUR ROOM BY THE CLEANING ATTENDANT!”
Reviews.Author: reviewsLA
Reviews.Content: we just returned from a cruise, and had left our souvenirs w/ our other things in the room. the night before checking out, we noticed they were missing and called security. security told us that they do BAG CHECKS OF ALL THEIR EMPLOYEES before they go home after a shift - obviously, they don't trust their employees at all. they took our statement, said an investigation would take 7 days, but we insisted on immediate action. the hotel manager was unable to reach the room attendant because 1) she failed to show up for her next shift and 2) refused to return his calls. the manager offered to reimburse us the money, but those souvenirs and gifts are gone. we called to follow up but the manager is ignoring us and not returning our calls. DON'T STAY HERE IF YOU VALUE YOUR BELONGINGS!

Reviews.Title: “Budget with a View”
Reviews.Author: conver2sations
Reviews.Content: Pros: -Location 1/2 off Michigian Ave. - Trendy/Modern furnishings - Price given location - 1 block max from several major bus routes (feels like we spent most of our trip on 151) - Rooftop Terrace: Great view of city Llghts at night - Huge showerhead - Large flatscreen that swivels b/w couch & bed (we didn't watch any TV though) - Lavazza Coffee Shop attached to lobby Cons: - Old Building = Tiny Elevators - WiFi isn't free in rooms (you see lots of guests with their laptops in the lobby). The WiFi is provided by WayPoint so if you have an acct w/them or AT&T you'll be ok, otherwise factor that in. - No Parking, but that's the norm for the area

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Value, Amazing Rooftop Terrace Available to Everyone (Weather Permitting)”
Reviews.Author: Bet_ur_azz
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel and great location. Main drawback is that the hotel does not have room service. We found out when we called to have a wine corkscrew brought up to our room. Instead, we had to go to the lobby bar where the bartender glady opened our bottle up for us. We then took our bottle up to the rooftop terrace to enjoy a glass of wine while watching the sun set over the city. Although no room service, they do have a coffeshop/cafe attached to the hotel at the lobby level, which came in very handy to grab a coffee and muffin on the go. Upon check-in, we told the staff member that it was our 1st anniversary and he upgraded our room for us and gave us a voucher for 2 free drinks at the bar!!! That kind of treatment alone will make me go stay there again. You couldn't ask for a better location to stay at as well. The hotel is very centrally located in the Mag Mile, and is a short walk to the River North area, and Navy Pier. The concierge was also very informative and helpful. Lastly, what I thought was very cool, was that the hotel lobby had a computer kiosk where you could get your real-time flight info, check in, and print your boarding pass from - all for free! Overall, a wonderul stay!

Reviews.Title: “Nice room and staff, budget price, Central location”
Reviews.Author: scappellee
Reviews.Content: This was a great room at a GREAT price - right in the center of the city. It was right on Miracle Mile, close to the main deep dish pizza places and a short walk to Navy Pier. I have stayed several times in the Chicago city center, and believe this hotel is a terrific value. The only drawbacks were that the bathroom was small and directly off the bedroom/main room wall and no free wireless in rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Ehh, mixed opinion.”
Reviews.Author: StephInStL
Reviews.Content: The room was a pretty decent size. I stayed with 4 kiddos. I was in a standard double room and we were not cramped. The room was clean and the bedding and pillows were WONDERFUL. I have seriously NEVER had a bed so comfortable. The bathroom was the tiniest I have ever seen. You really do have to sit on the toilet sideways. Turn the sink on slowly so as not to be drenched. Some of the staff were wonderful There was a younger (probably early 20's?) black lady and a middle aged white woman (probably 60?) that were both rude and acted very put out with any request for help or directions. The other 3 ladies were wonderful and very helpful. I purchased through lastminutetravel and got the room for $43 a night for 4 nights. I will stay again. With this hotel being in a nice area, accomidations wonderful and just a few steps from Michigan Ave. It is well worth a few snotty front desk ladies and a tiny bathroom. Also be aware that they charge a $50 per day hold to your card upon check in for a deposit, I complained and they took it off through. May not matter to some but a family on a tight budget may not be able to lose $200 of their vacation funds.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value”
Reviews.Author: arabwannabee
Reviews.Content: Although the standard rooms were quite nice, the small bathrooms were fitted with a large sink and a bulky wooden support which obstructs your seat. You'll need to sit sideways in order for things to work out. My colleague's room (1821) reeked of cigarette smoke which was attempted to be covered by an air freshener. The emotionless elderly receptionist coldly offered another room. The signs in the hotel indicate the fitness center is on the 3rd floor, but the room's directory (black binder) indicated it's on the 15th floor. The center consists of a couple of treadmills and 3 sets of small weights (that I didn't see). If you want (wireless) internet, you must spend time in the lobby, or spend $9.95 per day.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: nlh714
Reviews.Content: I would avoid this hotel. The pictures do not represent the hotel. Yes, the lobby is "nice" but the rooms are awful. When checking in, they asked if we would like a larger room but it would have only a shower, not tub. We agreed. The room was so small, we barely fit two people in it. They neglected to tell us the room was a handicap room so the shower head was not an appropriate height for a standing person. We could here EVERYTHING from another room through the vent in the bathroom. My husband ended up removing the grate and stuffing a towel in it. Everything from the hallways was amplified not to mention the ac/heating unit sounded as if it were going to take off to Mars. I was woken up each and everytime it turned on and shut off. We have stayed in hotels much nicer than this on the Mag Mile for roughly the same cost. Don't be fooled. Do your homework and you can find a better hotel for a great price. Oh and I believe it had been some time since the bathroom was last cleaned.

Reviews.Title: “Nice lobby, tiny rooms, lots of BED BUGS”
Reviews.Author: zach9582
Reviews.Content: Bed bugs. Stay away. I am pretty forgiving when it comes to hotels. I always stay at chains with my rewards points but this was cheap, looked very nice on the website, and had the perfect location. Since i was staying one night, i fugred, what the heck, take a chance. The hotel looks like the spent a lot of mone ymaking it look like a boutique in the lobby, but what they do spend on lobby decore they dont spend on cleaning staff or the room upkeep. The room was tiny, and the bathroom in this non-smoking room reeked of smoke. All of this i could forgive becayse it was one night and i wasn't spending much time in the room. The next morning i woke up with over 100 bed bug bites. They found the bugs after i left and say they have corrected the problem, but you dont get 100 bed bug bites unless its ben a problem for a very long time. It is one month later and I still have people asking me what all those red dots are on my arms.

Reviews.Title: “Gets the Job Done!”
Reviews.Author: Faitch
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a no frills place to make your base on a business trip to Chicago. Clean room, comfortable bed and a great shower means all the boxes are ticked. However, there are no restaurant or breakfast facilities (there's a small coffee shop adjacent, though, which serves great croissant) and no room service. Staff are friendly and very helpful and the hotel is conveniently placed to get around town on foot or via the "L" or Metra trains.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT BUDGET HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: spunkylulu
Reviews.Content: Great central location, trendy lobby and helpful staff. Rooms not that great. It was freezing cold even with heater running non-stop...mind you it was in January. Bath room is incredibly tiny. no hot water when i went to take a shower. Despite the quality of the room, as long as you dont plan to spend too much time in your room, the hotel is in a great location with friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “I adore this place!”
Reviews.Author: astridd
Reviews.Content: This place is amazing! It's wonderfully central, I don't think it took longer than 15 minutes to walk anywhere I wanted to go. I went with a friend of mine to visit some of our Chicago friends and I have to say we booked it because it was cheap given the location. $80 per night roughly! We had a double double room which came with the usual TV, iron, ironing board, hairdryer, phone and a coffee maker. The beds were more comfortable than mine at home! They were lovely and clean and the bathroom had a real designer feel to it. We were on the 14th floor and even from there the views were pretty amazing! The staff were amazing, Victor, who works on the transport/bell boy desk was so friendly and knowledgeable. Lindsey, the concierge seriously couldn't do enough for you and Simeon, the receptionist recommended so many nice places to eat! You could just say the word breakfast to him and he'd list off half a dozen places to go! It was freezing in Chicago when we visited, got down to a positively siberian -26 celcius but the hotel was always so warm, and the fully adjustable heating/air con in the room was a god send! There's a lovely little coffee shop attatched to the hotel that serves snacks and as for the bar, well, lets just say between us we sampled a lot of the cocktail menu, and I'd recommend most of them! All in all, I'd recommend this hotel to everyone! Great for girly weekends, couples, great for everyone in fact!

Reviews.Title: “can,t see what the fuss is about”
Reviews.Author: Ted07
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Inn of Chicago for 3 nights in Jan 2009. We found this hotel to be perfectly acceptable considering the much higher charges of other hotels in the surrounding area. We stayed in the city for just over a week where we spent the first 4 nights in a different hotel just around the corner as we were on business there. When we enquired as to the cost of staying in our present hotel we were quoted a price of $970. Considering the Inn of Chicago was approximately one third of the price, there wasn,t that much difference. Agreed the bathroom is quite small but who spends their holidays in the bathroom. The heating in the room is quite old but was considerably quieter than the one in our previous hotel. Overall the room was a decent size,staff were fine,bed comfortable and all in a fantastic location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Tiny Bathroom”
Reviews.Author: Ogre
Reviews.Content: The Location of the Hotel cant be better if you want to be yards from Magnificient Mile and its Designer Shops. Check In was painless and quick. The only part I dont like is where the Hotel takes a swipe of your Credit Card for Incidentals. We went up to our room which was on the 20th floor which I had requested. On entering the room the one thing you notice is lack of Storage space which my wife always gets first lol. The Bathroom is tiny even smaller than rooms I have stayed in Europe and not been thought out properly but hey who stays in the Bathroom on Holiday? Noise in the Hotel was minimal only the sound of sirens on the busy streets of Chicago down below. Another thing that got my goat was you had to wear wristbands on New Years Eve to get back into the Hotel which I have never had to do anywhere else apart from when doing All Inclusive strange!!! Nearby is a good Thai restaurant although they can be a bit pushy for tips.
